imitator: <entryFree id="n21660" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imitator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copyist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mimic</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21660.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulti imitatores principum exsistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 115</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 14: veterum facinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus erat stulti sapiens imitator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:717" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 618</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21660.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura fingit homines et creat imitatores et narratores facetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec desilies imitator in artum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o imitatores, servum pecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imitatorius: <entryFree id="n21661" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imitator</etym>, <sense id="n21661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secondary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitative</hi> (opp. originale): <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cont. Jul. 6:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cont. Jul. 6, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imitatrix: <entryFree id="n21662" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that imitates</hi> (rare but class.): boni (voluptas), Cic. Leg. <cb n="IMMA" /> 1, 17, 47: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tusc. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis imitatrix ac parasita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imitatus: <entryFree id="n21663" type="main" key="i^mi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>imitor</etym>, <sense id="n21663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imitation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imito: <entryFree id="n21664" type="main" key="i^mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. imitor <sense id="n21664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imitor: <entryFree id="n21665" type="main" key="i^mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n21665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> imitarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1377</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. freq. a. dep.</hi> [root im-, cf. aemulus], <hi rend="ital">to imitate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21665.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portray</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">summum illum luctum penicillo,</quote> <trans><tr>to portray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oris (Coae Veneris) pulchritudo reliqui corporis imitandi spem auferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut Ialysi aut Coae Veneris pulchritudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber ungues Exprimet et molles imitabitur aere capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argillā quidvis imitabitur udā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc in persona lenonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi speciem et nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36, 137</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heroum veteres casus fictosque luctus imitari atque adumbrare dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:5:47:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 5, 47, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitans, ut est mos, facta et dicta vivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine imitandorum carminum actu ludiones,</quote> <trans><tr>not expressing by gesticulation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">maestitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque (pictura) imitata figuram est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:341" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 341</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: putre solum imitamur arando, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robore duro Stipitibus ferrum sudibusque imitantur obustis,</quote> <trans><tr>replace</tr>, <tr>substitute</tr>, <tr>supply the place of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 894</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula vitea fermento atque sorbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 380</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturni mores consensu utentium comprobati legem imitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21665.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to resemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi> something (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">imitabor nepam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitabor ergo Aratum, qui magnis de rebus dicere exordiens, a Jove incipiendum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imitor Archytam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem imitando effingere atque exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (eloquentem) si imitari atque exprimere non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem postea imitati sunt multi, aequavit nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi sibi imitandi fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:177" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui maxime imitandus, et solus imitandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi maxime imitabilis, maxime imitandus videbaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster ille amicus, dignus huic ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">populi consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dicam plura, ne, in quo te objurgem, id ipsum videar imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adeundis periculis consuetudo imitanda medicorum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod faciendum imitandumque est omnibus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum praeclarum expositum ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (sc. domo) sollicitas imitatur janua portas,</quote> <trans><tr>resembles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 42</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n21665.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (anteclass.): si malos imitabo, Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 22</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 1 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuum opus nemo imitare potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21665.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitata et efficta simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint alii veri affectus, alii ficti et imitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec abest imitata voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 481</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Fab. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imitus: <entryFree id="n21666" type="main" key="i_mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īmĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>imus</etym>, <sense id="n21666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the bottom</hi>, = funditus (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fontes imitus ignes eructare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:20:4" default="NO">2, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra dehiscente imitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immaculabilis: <entryFree id="n21667" type="main" key="imma^cu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immăcŭlābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmaculo</etym>, <sense id="n21667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be stained</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">conscientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. ad Gratian. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immaculatus: <entryFree id="n21668" type="main" key="imma^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immăcŭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unstained</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: integer, incorruptus): Romana tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 736</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 1, 20 al.</sense></entryFree>
immaculo: <entryFree id="n21669" type="main" key="imma^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immăcŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stain</hi> (late Lat.), Firm. Math. 1, 2; 4, 16.</sense></entryFree>
immadesco: <entryFree id="n21670" type="main" key="imma^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immădesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype> (only in the <sense id="n21670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-madesco], <hi rend="ital">to become wet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moist</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">credibile est, lacrimis immaduisse genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra a siccitate continua immaduit imbre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immadido: <entryFree id="n21671" type="main" key="imma^di^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immădĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-madidus</etym>, <pb n="891" /> <cb n="IMMA" /> <sense id="n21671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Exc. Frat. 2, 12</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immane: <entryFree id="n21672" type="main" key="imma_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immāne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immanis <sense id="n21672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immaneo: <entryFree id="n21673" type="main" key="imma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immănĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-maneo</etym>, <sense id="n21673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain in</hi> (late Lat.): cur non possit ... caelum levioribus immanere vaporibus? Aug. de Gen. ad lit. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immanifestus: <entryFree id="n21674" type="main" key="imma^ni^festus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immănĭfestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-manifestus</etym>, <sense id="n21674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not obvious</hi>, Ruf. Gr. de Metris, 2710 P.</sense></entryFree>
immanis: <entryFree id="n21675" type="main" key="imma_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immānis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>i. e. in- and old Lat. mānus=bonus; kindr. with Sanscr. ma=metior, to measure; Lat. mānes, good spirits</etym>, <sense id="n21675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi> in size, <hi rend="ital">enormous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21675.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (usually of inanim. and abstr. things): <cit><quote lang="la">corporum magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra immani magnitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immani corpore serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:987" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 987</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens immanisque praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immania ponti Aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca vasto hiatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barathrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumen leonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 552</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna atque immanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentia amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminos immani pondere caestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus redit immanis: numquam fuit par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>, b, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">dissensio civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soloecismus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsae praeceps inmane ruinae,</quote> <trans><tr>the vast crash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 107</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: Immane quantum animi exarsere, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 27</bibl> (2, 79 Dietsch); so, <cit><quote lang="la">vino et lucernis Medus acinaces Immane quantum discrepat,</quote> <trans><tr>how exceedingly</tr>, <tr>wonderfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis lapsu equi prostratus immane quantum suis pavoris et hostibus alacritatis indidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: quod matrimonium Aemiliano huic immane quanto fuit, App. Mag.; <cit><quote lang="la">and in full: immane dictu est, quanti et quam multi ad Pompeium discesserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Orat. ad Caes. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Orat. ad Caes. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21675.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi> in character, <hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhuman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi> (class.; syn.: ferus, immitis, barbarus, durus, saevus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. mansuetus, mitis): hostis in ceteris rebus nimis ferus et immanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla gens tam fera, nemo omnium tam immanis, cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex feris et immanibus mites reddidit et mansuetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad humanitatem atque mansuetudinem revocavit animos hominum studiis bellandi jam immanes ac feros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua (with fera),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with taetra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis et vasta belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ista immanius belua est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor aulae, Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc populo indomito, vel potius immani, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius immanis atque importuna natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis, intolerandus, vesanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis ac barbara consuetudo hominum immolandorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum facinus, tam immane (patris occidendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptis effera Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Raeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agathyrsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 162</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immānĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">frightful deeds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sayings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis fabulosa et immania credebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>stories however fabulous and frightful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira atque inmania pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 104</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere ante alios immanior omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 347</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem immanissimus quisque acerrime sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:25:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 25, 90</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-māne</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">immānĭter</orth> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n21675.3" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Monstrously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immaniter clamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 8</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n21675.4" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Frightfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savagely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wildly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21675.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form immane: <cit><quote lang="la">leo hians immane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonat fluctus per saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 239</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fremant torrentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirans rapta securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21675.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form immaniter: leones per ea loca saevientes immaniter, <cb n="IMME" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdite et immaniter vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:37" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21675.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanius efferascunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immanitas: <entryFree id="n21676" type="main" key="imma_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immanis</etym>. <sense id="n21676.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Monstrous size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hugeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vastness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess</hi> (very rare, but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">serpens inusitatae immanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21676.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Monstrousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heinousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarism</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ista in figura hominis feritas et immanitas beluae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feritas quaedam atque agrestis immanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multas esse gentes sic immanitate efferatas ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni diritate atque immanitate taeterrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter feras satius est aetatem degere, quam in tanta immanitate versari,</quote> <trans><tr>in such barbarism</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas et immanitas naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum immanitate vastissimas vincit beluas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animo, stupor in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantiam immanitas in voluptatibus aspernandis imitatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Antonii tanta est non insolentia (nam id quidem vulgare vitium est), sed immanitas, non modo ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti facinoris immanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priorum temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (v. Madv. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
immaniter: <entryFree id="n21677" type="main" key="imma_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immānĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immanis <sense id="n21677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immansuetus: <entryFree id="n21678" type="main" key="immansue_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immansuētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-mansuetus</etym>, <sense id="n21678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ille ferox immansuetusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu (Borea), de rapidis immansuetissime ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trucem atque immansuetum bovem caedimus, Sen. de Ira, 1, 15: ingenium immansuetum ferumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid immansuetius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immarcescibilis: <entryFree id="n21679" type="main" key="immarcesci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immarcescĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmarcesco</etym>, <sense id="n21679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfading</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immasticatus: <entryFree id="n21680" type="main" key="immasti^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immastĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>in-mastico</etym>, <sense id="n21680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not chewed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not masticated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:3:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 3, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immature: <entryFree id="n21681" type="main" key="imma_tu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immātūrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immaturus <sense id="n21681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immaturitas: <entryFree id="n21682" type="main" key="imma_tu_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immātūrĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immaturus</etym>. <sense id="n21682.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unripeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immatureness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n21682.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Untimely haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-eagerness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid haec festinatio, quid haec immaturitas tanta significat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immaturus: <entryFree id="n21683" type="main" key="imma_tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immātūrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmaturus</etym>, <sense id="n21683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untimely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before the season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immature</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21683.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of plants and fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21683.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">vomica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans immaturus est editus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not yet marriageable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:32:section=27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 1, 32, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <trans><tr>untimely</tr>, <tr>premature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interitus C. Gracchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filius obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans><tr>early dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi hinc cum inmaturo amore ad sponsum,</quote> <trans><tr>unseasonable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immātūrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">untimely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immaturely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immedicabilis: <entryFree id="n21684" type="main" key="imme^di^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕdĭcābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmedicabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incurable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n21684.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <trans><tr>the wound of which is incurable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 858</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21684.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:147" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:292" default="NO">14, 292</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immedicatus: <entryFree id="n21685" type="main" key="imme^di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕdĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-medicor</etym>, <sense id="n21685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 12</bibl></cit>: aegritudo, Hilar. Trin. 6, 3.</sense></entryFree>
immeditate: <entryFree id="n21686" type="main" key="imme^di^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕdĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n21686.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
immeditatus: <entryFree id="n21687" type="main" key="imme^di^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕdĭtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmeditatus</etym>, <sense id="n21687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unstudied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpremeditated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sonores animalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Met. 2, p. 115, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕdĭtātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without premeditation</hi>, Gell. praef. § 10.</sense></entryFree>
immeio: <entryFree id="n21688" type="hapax" key="imme_io"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immēio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-meio</etym>, <sense id="n21688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water into;</hi> transf., in mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">patriciae vulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:73" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immemor: <entryFree id="n21689" type="main" key="imme^mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕmor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ŏris</itype> (ante-class. in <cb n="IMME" /> the <sense id="n21689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> immemoris, Caecil. ap. Prisc. pp. 699 and 772 P.; Com. Fragm. v. 31 Rib.; <case>abl.</case> immemori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:248" default="NO" valid="yes">248</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">al. immemore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 3, 3</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-memor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unmindful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgetful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regardless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi> of a thing. </sense><sense id="n21689.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">gen.;</hi> less freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21689.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeone immemor rerum a me gestarum esse videor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hesternorum immemores, acta pueritiae recordari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me immemorem mandati tui putares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius mandati tui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec erat (L. Gellius) Romanarum rerum immemor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he was not ignorant of Roman history</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator tenerae conjugis immemor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemor in testando nepotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium immemor difficultatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum (juvenca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graminis (cervus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua cibi qua quietis inmemor nox traducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis immemores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21689.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna haec immemoris ingenii signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:218" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemori discedens pectore conjux,</quote> <trans><tr>unfeeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:ib. 249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possimne ingratus et immemor esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21689.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihili est, suum Qui officium facere immemor est, nisi adeo monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; and with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemor, Chaeream Cassium nominari,</quote> <trans><tr>never thinking</tr>, <tr>not considering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21689.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that causes forgetfulness</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Lethe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:96" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:478" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 478</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 936" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 936</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immemorabilis: <entryFree id="n21690" type="main" key="imme^mo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕmŏrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-memorabilis</etym> (ante-class.). <sense id="n21690.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmentionable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indescribable</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">a)dih/ghtos</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">spurcidioi versus immemorabiles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unworthy to be mentioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 488</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n21690.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that will not tell any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speechless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immemoratio: <entryFree id="n21691" type="main" key="imme^mo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕmŏrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immemor</etym>, <sense id="n21691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmindfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgetfulness</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immemoratus: <entryFree id="n21692" type="main" key="imme^mo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕmŏrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-memoratus</etym>, <sense id="n21692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmentioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not related</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">juvat immemorata ferentem Ingenuis oculisque legi manibusque teneri,</quote> <trans><tr>not yet related</tr>, <tr>new</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tu jam metris meis immemoratus eris,</quote> <trans><tr>unsung</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immemoria: <entryFree id="n21693" type="main" key="imme^mo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕmŏrĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-memoria</etym>, <sense id="n21693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmindfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgetfulness</hi> (= oblivio; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.): cum reversus locum thesauri immemoriā non repeteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immemoris: <entryFree id="n21694" type="main" key="imme^mo^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕmŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. immemor <sense id="n21694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immendo: <entryFree id="n21695" type="main" key="immendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immendo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-mendum</etym>, <sense id="n21695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to involve in a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implicate</hi>: quos non emendamus, sed nos potius immendamus, Aug. Cont. Mendac, 3, 6.</sense></entryFree>
immensitas: <entryFree id="n21696" type="main" key="immensi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immensĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immensus</etym>, <sense id="n21696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immeasurableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensity</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">latitudinum, longitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensitates camporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immensurabilis: <entryFree id="n21697" type="main" key="immensu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immensūrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n21697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immeasurable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> de Stat An. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immensuratus: <entryFree id="n21698" type="main" key="immensu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immensūrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n21698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not measured</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immensus: <entryFree id="n21699" type="main" key="immensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmensus</etym>, <sense id="n21699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immeasurable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immense</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: infinitus, ingens, interminatus). </sense><sense id="n21699.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n21699.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si immensam et interminatam in omnes partes magnitudinem regionum videretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra deum statuit eumque gigni esseque immensum et infinitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ingenti quodam oratorem immensoque campo in exiguum sane gyrum compellitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mari immenso vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:640" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">series laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacuitque per antrum Immensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 632</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis eorum juventus infinita numero, immensa corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti pondus et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 41</bibl>: pretiis <pb n="892" /> <cb n="IMME" /> emere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">observata sunt haec tempore immenso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21699.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measureless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa vorago aut gurges vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensae, infinitae, immoderatae cupiditates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis cruoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>: fervet immensusque ruit profundo Pindarus ore, <hi rend="ital">fathomless</hi> (the fig. being taken from a river), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum est, erratas dicere terras,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no end of recounting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 573</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod persequi immensum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">immensissimae voluptates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21699.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n21699.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a boundless extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immense size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensity</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): extra Processit longe flammantia moenia mundi, Atque omne immensum peragravit mente animoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 957</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per immensum ventis discordibus actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proruta per immensum aedificia,</quote> <trans><tr>over a vast extent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mercari immenso,</quote> <trans><tr>at an enormous price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 40, 64, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons saxeus in immensum editus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardet in immensum geminatis ignibus Aetne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad immensum aliquid augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid immenso plus laudare,</quote> <trans><tr>immoderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21699.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immensum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensely</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">creverat immensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:537" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum attolli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus immensum proruperat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum quantum hinc Oceano, illinc Hiberico mari conprimentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:172" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 36, 66, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immeo: <entryFree id="n21700" type="main" key="imme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-meo</etym>, <sense id="n21700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">delphini inmeantes Nilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cisternis (aqua),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inmeans spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 92, § 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immerens: <entryFree id="n21701" type="main" key="imme^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕrens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n21701.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inque merentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1104</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmereo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">undeserving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not meriting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">indignus): triste lignum, caducum In domini caput immerentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam immerentia,</quote> <trans><tr>innocent</tr>, <tr>harmless things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitum efferre injuriam tibi immerenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-mĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who is innocent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">does not deserve</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">male mereri de inmerenti inscitiast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕrenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">undeservedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Philippo rege temulento immerenter damnata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.</sense></entryFree>
immergo: <entryFree id="n21702" type="main" key="immergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immergo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n21702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> immersti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 26</bibl>; acc. to the second conj., <hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> immergeri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-mergo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to dip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stick into</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to immerse</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n21702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus in aquam ferventem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 15, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immersus in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aqua cui subinde (ferrum) candens immergitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautas pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem arboris deflexam terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem spumosā undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immergi melle cotoneà,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alto (belua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: ubi Hister amnis inmergitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pours itself into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at quidem tute errasti, quom parum inmersti ampliter (sc. manus),</quote> <trans><tr>did not dip deep enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21702.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: se aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunge one's self into</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">immersit aliquo sese credo in ganeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in contionem mediam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter mucrones se hostium immersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21702.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se blanditiis et assentationibus in alicujus consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se penitus Pythagorae praeceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
immerito: <entryFree id="n21703" type="main" key="imme^ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕrĭto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immeritus <sense id="n21703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immeritus: <entryFree id="n21704" type="main" key="imme^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕrĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmeritus</etym>, <sense id="n21704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undeserved</hi> (in the <pos>adj.</pos> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n21704.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <cb n="IMMI" /> <hi rend="ital">that has not deserved</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">undeserving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guiltless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta majorum immeritus lues, Romane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of persons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:274" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl> § 4; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit> (13).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus recludens immeritis mori Caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inmĕrĭ-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the absence of guilt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tu, obsecro, immerito meo me morti dedere optas?</quote> <trans><tr>for no fault of mine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21704.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is not deserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmerited</hi> (much less freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus haud immeritis onerare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credulus immerita Phasida juvit ope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:158" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 158</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕrĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">undeservedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjustly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without cause</hi> (esp. freq. with a negative): <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum te omnes nos accusare audio Immerito, et me omnium horunc immeritissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: si praeter opinionem, si immerito, si misera, si ingrata, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud equidem immerito Cumanae carmine vatis Cautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos non immerito probaverit sanctissimus censor,</quote> <trans><tr>with perfect justice</tr>, <tr>justly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non immerito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:12" default="NO">9, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:35" default="NO">9, 4, 35</bibl>; 10, 1, 116; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque immerito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> § 2; 7, 7, 1; 10, 1, 27; 11, 2, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 75: nec immerito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
immersabilis: <entryFree id="n21705" type="hapax" key="immersa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immersābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmerso</etym>, <sense id="n21705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be sunk</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ulixes) adversis rerum immersabilis undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immersio: <entryFree id="n21706" type="main" key="immersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immersĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immergo</etym>, <sense id="n21706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunging into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immersion</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immersus: <entryFree id="n21707" type="main" key="immersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from immergo.</entryFree>
immetatus: <entryFree id="n21708" type="hapax" key="imme_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immētātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-meto</etym>, <sense id="n21708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmeasured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
