immetuens: <entryFree id="n21709" type="gloss" key="imme^tu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĕtŭens</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/fobos, a)me/rimnos</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
immigro: <entryFree id="n21710" type="main" key="immi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immī^gro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-migro</etym>, <sense id="n21710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go into</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n21710.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et in domum et in paternos hortos immigrabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam insolitum domicilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illo (i. e. in aedes) immigrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21710.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque (verba) translata: sic tamen, ut ea non irruisse in alienum locum, sed immigrasse in suum diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: nulla res publica fuit, in quam tam serae avaritia luxuriaque immigraverint, Liv. prooem. § 11: posteaque immigravi in ingenium meum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">gave myself up to it</hi> (the fig. being taken from a house; v. the passage in connection). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imminentia: <entryFree id="n21711" type="hapax" key="immi^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immineo</etym>, <sense id="n21711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearness</hi>: ab instantia atque imminentia fraudis, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immineo: <entryFree id="n21712" type="main" key="immi^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-mineo</etym>, <sense id="n21712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to project over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lean towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hang down over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overhang</hi> (syn. impendeo). </sense><sense id="n21712.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">collis plurimus urbi Imminet,</quote> <trans><tr>commands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 420</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imminens prope ipsis moenibus tumulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminens villae tua pinus esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida populus antro Imminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelumque quod imminet orbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulus aequoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:525" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex collis subjectis arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:779" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus desuper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminet e celsis audentius improba muris Virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:681" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">choros ducit Venus imminente luna,</quote> <trans><tr>shining overhead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: cum ageretur togata, simulans, caterva tota clarissima concentione in ore impuri hominis imminens contionata est: Huic vitae tuae, etc., <hi rend="ital">bending</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning towards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gestu omni imminenti,</quote> <trans><tr>bent towards him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21712.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be near to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to touch on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">border upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21712.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">imminet hic, sequiturque parem, similisque tenenti Non tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo fugacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="IMMI" /> 542: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer imminens foro,</quote> <trans><tr>adjoining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminentia muro aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 33, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21712.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (like impendere and instare), in an inimical sense, <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menace</hi>, by nearness or commanding position (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis imminebat propter propinquitatem Aegina Piraeeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago imminere jam fructuosissimis insulis populi Romani videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certior sum factus, Parthos ... Ciliciae magis imminere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminent duo reges toti Asiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum insulas Italiae inminentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates Italiae quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthi Latio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germaniae et Britanniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello subegit gentem rebus populi Romani imminentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instabat agmen Caesaris atque universum imminebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrium divina avis imminentŭm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris ingens inminebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inminentes tumuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21712.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21712.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strive eagerly ofter</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to be eager for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be intent upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus mendicitas aviditate conjuncta in nostras fortunas imminebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alterius ducis exercitusque opprimendi occasionem imminebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc imminet: om nes Dirigit huc sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieno imminere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod imminere emptioni publicanos videbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritus rerum popularium imminensque ei potestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei majoris honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasioni alloquendi regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitio conjugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verres avaritia semper hiante atque imminenti fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21712.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to be near at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21712.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui ea, quae quotidie imminent, non videant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors, quae propter incertos casus quotidie imminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21712.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi> by nearness, <hi rend="ital">to be imminent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum, quod imminere ipsi portenderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum ambobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminentes undique insidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimina undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedio praesentium et imminentium metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imminuo: <entryFree id="n21713" type="main" key="immi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inminuo</etym>, <sense id="n21713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi> a thing (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.; cf. diminuo, comminuo). </sense><sense id="n21713.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21713.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si istas exiguas copias quam minime imminueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21713.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfeeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus otio, animum libidinibus imminuebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gauda, morbis confectus, et ob eam caussam mente paululum inminuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires (Venus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1017</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 626</bibl>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 350</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n21713.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21713.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivorum tempus comitiorum mora imminuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod populi semper proprium fuit, quod nemo imminuit, nemo mutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminuitur aliquid de voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex consuetudine luxus atque desidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam se dolor imminuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum imminutum,</quote> <trans><tr>contracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21713.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to encroach upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum jus tam sanctum atque integrum, quod non ejus scelus atque perfidia violarit et imminuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas imminuta ac debilitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum attenuatum atque imminutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus legationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">84: laudem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 17</bibl></cit>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bocchi pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 81:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 81, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes hominum (ebrietas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippa discidio domum imminuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> only in Tac.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam Augusta se violari et imminui quereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perculso Seneca, promptum fuit Rufum Fenium imminuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">diminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smaller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus intercalandi interdum cumulatior, interdum imminutior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 44</bibl></cit> <pb n="893" /> <cb n="IMMI" /></sense></entryFree>
imminutio: <entryFree id="n21714" type="main" key="immi^nu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imminuo</etym>, <sense id="n21714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lessening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aiminution; a weakening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impairing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injuring</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n21714.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravitas imminutioque corporis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mutilation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>. —In mal. part., i. q. devirgin tio, <hi rend="ital">a deflowering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Cent. Nupt. Idyll. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21714.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21714.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21714.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a figure of speech, <hi rend="ital">the use of a weaker expression for a stronger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:90" default="NO">9, 3, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imminutus: <entryFree id="n21715" type="main" key="immi^nu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from imminuo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21716" type="main" key="immi^nu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭnūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-minutus</etym>, <sense id="n21716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undiminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpaired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unviolated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jus suum habere imminutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:44" default="NO">38, 2, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immisceo: <entryFree id="n21717" type="main" key="immisce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immiscĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>scŭi, xtum, or stum, 2</itype> (archaic <sense id="n21717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> immiscerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 454</bibl>) <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-misceo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to mix in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blend</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n21717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina farinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:3" default="NO">12, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:6" default="NO">12, 38, 6</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos meorum militum corpori immiscui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti per modica intervalla agmini immixti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis ima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin maculae incipient rutilo immiscerier igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immixta corporibus semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 393</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 877</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immixtus castris hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis se immiscuit armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 815</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">feminas metus turbae virorum immiscuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se nubi atrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 662</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21717.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cling to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis immiscet cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 829" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 829</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21717.3" n="C" level="2"> Esp.: se immiscere, or immisceri, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite with</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">associate with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbae servientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbae sacricolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur immisceri sibi in cavea patres plebem nollent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites se peditibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se immiscuit mediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteribus militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 38, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimus immixti Danais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alienae familiae venali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se pavonum gregi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21717.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21717.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestibus immisceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si virtuti se voluptas immiscuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 87, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera falsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 90:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 90, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim vitia virtutibus inmixta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 114:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 114, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fugienda petendis Immiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus necessitudinibus immiscere te mihi parem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immixtaque vota timori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec parvis periculis immixtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21717.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n21717.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi> one thing with another: <cit><quote lang="la">sortem fortunae regnique sui cum rebus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 14, 3</bibl></cit> (dub. Weissenb. ex conj. miscuisset).—</sense><sense id="n21717.8" n="2" level="3"> Se immiscere (immisceri) alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to take part in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concern one's self with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meddle with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fero et contionibus et comitiis se immiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne adfinitatibus, ne propinquitatibus immisceamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Philippus rebus Graeciae immisceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se immiscuissent colloquiis montanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fidenati bello se jam ante immiscuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se negotiis alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se bonis hereditariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:163" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immiserabilis: <entryFree id="n21718" type="main" key="immi^se^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭsĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmiserabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpitied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periret immiserabilis Captiva pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21718.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pitiless</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 315</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immisericordia: <entryFree id="n21719" type="main" key="immi^se^ri^cordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭsĕrĭcordĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immisericors</etym>, <sense id="n21719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitilessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmercifulness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immisericorditer: <entryFree id="n21720" type="main" key="immi^se^ri^cordi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭsĕrĭcordĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immisericors.</entryFree>
immisericors: <entryFree id="n21721" type="main" key="immi^se^ri^cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭsĕrĭcors</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmisericors</etym>, <sense id="n21721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitiless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merciless</hi> (very rare, but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum immisericordem, superbum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:36:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 36, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex immisericors atque inexorabilis contra improbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of things: flucti (i. e. fluctus) inmisericordes jacere, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 12</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 33 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:50:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 50, 42</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭsĕrĭcordĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unmercifully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum a vobis duriter immisericorditerque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immiseror: <entryFree id="n21722" type="hapax" key="immi^se^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immĭsĕror</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n21722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [in-miseror], <hi rend="ital">to pity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commiserate</hi>: boni immiserantur<cb n="IMMI" />  illum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 30</bibl> dub. (al. miserantur).</sense></entryFree>
immissarium: <entryFree id="n21723" type="main" key="immissa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immissārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>immitto</etym>, <sense id="n21723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cistern</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reservoir</hi> attached to an aqueduct, <hi rend="ital">a distributing reservoir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immissio: <entryFree id="n21724" type="main" key="immissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immissĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letting in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admission</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fumi aut aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 8, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentorum ea aliorum amputatio, aliorum inmissio,</quote> <trans><tr>an engrafting</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immissus: <entryFree id="n21725" type="main" key="immissus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from immitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21726" type="hapax" key="immissus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>immitto</etym>, <sense id="n21726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letting in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol cuncta lustrat lucis immissu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immistus: <entryFree id="n21727" type="main" key="immistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immistus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. immixtus.</entryFree>
immite: <entryFree id="n21728" type="main" key="immi_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immīte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immitis <sense id="n21728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immitigabilis: <entryFree id="n21729" type="main" key="immi_ti^ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immītĭgābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmitigo</etym>, <sense id="n21729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be softened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allayed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immitigable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:33" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immitis: <entryFree id="n21730" type="main" key="immi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immītis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-mitis</etym>, <sense id="n21730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sour</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n21730.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of fruit: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus (opp. dulcis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 6, § 26</bibl></cit>. —More freq., </sense><sense id="n21730.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexorable</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarus, trux, torvus, immanis, ferox, crudelis, saevus): naturā et moribus immitis ferusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">asper et immitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogans, profusus, immitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus (i. e. Pluto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">Glycera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immitibus et desertis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulam Gyarum immitem et sine cultu hominum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immite et turbidum caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidi (i. e. hirundinum apibus infestarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara (on which human beings are offered),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Nuce 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescriptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes pariter fugientium ac resistentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59, 6</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immītĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">barbarous acts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausae immitia nuptae (i. e. abortus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:625" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 625</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus operis ac laboris, et eo immitior, quia toleraverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcato immitior hydro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 804</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes immitissimum animalium genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 96, § 207</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-mīte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridorque immite rudentum Sibilat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:257" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immitto: <entryFree id="n21731" type="main" key="immitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immitto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>īsi, issum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n21731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> immisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 354</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-mitto</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">let into</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to introduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">despatch against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let loose at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throw into</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. intromitto, induco, introduco). </sense><sense id="n21731.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21731.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">servos ad spoliandum fanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servi in tecta nostra cum facibus immissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:36:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 36, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis hominum simul immissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatu immisso (in agmen hostium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armaturam levem in stationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificem mediis flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">completas naves taeda et pice in Pomponianam classem immisit,</quote> <trans><tr>let loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101, 2</bibl></cit>; so ib. § 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: repente equum immisi ad eam legionem, <hi rend="ital">urged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurred</hi>, Galb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si effrenatos in eos equos immittitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum ex manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canalibus aqua immissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam ex fullonicis in fundum vicini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cloacam privatam in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">puram aquam in alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (tigna) cum machinationibus immissa in flumen defixerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had driven into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipedales trabes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">6: tigna (in parietem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:25:3" default="NO">43, 25, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>hurls it to the sky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentum filis immittitur aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>is inserted</tr>, <tr>interwoven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa oneratas veste cervices laticlaviam immiserat mappam,</quote> <trans><tr>put on</tr>, <tr>put around</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexteraque immissis da mihi signa rotis,</quote> <trans><tr>let loose</tr>, <tr>swiftly driven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:58" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immissis pars caeca et concita frenis Arietat in portas,</quote> <trans><tr>slackened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 889</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 662</bibl></cit>; Ov. <cb n="IMMO" /> M. 1, 280; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rudentes,</quote> <trans><tr>let go</tr>, <tr>let loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Codrus in medios se immisit hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>threw himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in hostium manum multitudinemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immisit in armatas hostium copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offirmastin' occultare, quo te inmittas,</quote> <trans><tr>whither you are going</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21731.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21731.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To send against</hi> (secretly or hostilely), <hi rend="ital">to set on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suborn</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">alii Tarquinium a Cicerone immissum aiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem Tiberium inopinantem repente immisso tribuno militum interemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immissis qui monerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suillium accusandis utrisque immittit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cujus rei probationem immittet indices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia et a dissimilibus delator inmissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21731.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To let grow unrestrained</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vitis immittitur ad uvas pariendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus immittitur in perticas asseresve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro densitate arborum immissorumque aliorum in alios ramorum,</quote> <trans><tr>grown together</tr>, <tr>interwoven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: penitus immissis radicibus niti, <hi rend="ital">deeply planted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sunk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>: barba immissa et intonso capillo, etc., <hi rend="ital">overgrown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 130, 8</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">barba immissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 593</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 351</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immissi capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 503</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 338</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 168</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in a Greek construction: Phleias immissus patrios de vertice crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:412" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 412</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21731.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ingraft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci resecantur, et ... deinde feraces plantae immittuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21731.7" n="4" level="3"> Aliquem in bona alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to install</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in possession</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21731.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to listen to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; but without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu quod istic fabuletur auris inmittas tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: verba suis immittere figuris, <hi rend="ital">to accommodate its modes of thought</hi> to the words, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactam et immissam a te nefariam in me injuriam semper duxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic corrector in eo ipso loco, quo reprehendit, immittit imprudens ipse senarium,</quote> <trans><tr>lets escape him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil extrinsecus accidit, quod corpus ejus in aliquam valetudinem immitteret,</quote> <trans><tr>threw into some sickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:21:14:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 21, 14, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immisitque fugam Teucris atrumque timorem,</quote> <trans><tr>instilled</tr>, <tr>infused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:353" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 554" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 554</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immixtus: <entryFree id="n21732" type="main" key="immixtus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immixtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from immisceo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21733" type="main" key="immixtus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immixtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmixtus</etym>, <sense id="n21733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmixed</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
immo: <entryFree id="n21734" type="main" key="immo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immo</orth>, incorrectly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">īmo</orth> <etym>perh. <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> form from in, with ending mo; cf.: summus, primus; hence</etym>, <sense id="n21734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by no means</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">yes indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi> (more commonly contradicting or essentially qualifying what precedes; but never, like minime, as an independent negative, being regularly accompanied by a clause defining the meaning; v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 551). </sense><sense id="n21734.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21734.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Etiam fatetur de hospite? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Immo pernegat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 19</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">An.</hi> Ubi? domin'? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Immo apud libertum Discum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 60</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Hae quid ad me? <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Immo ad te attinent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 27</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Faciat, ut voles. <hi rend="ital">Nau.</hi> Immo ejus judicio permitto omnia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 28</bibl>.—Esp., in a reply extending or amplifying the preceding thought (cf.: potius, quin potius): expedies? nempe ut modo? <hi rend="ital">D.</hi> Immo melius spero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 80</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Quid? hoc intellextin'? an nondum etiam ne hoc quidem? <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Immo callide, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur faciat, dixerit quis, quod utile sit, quod expediat? Immo intelligat nihil nec expedire nec utile esse, quod sit injustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa igitur non bona est? Immo optima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem hominem? levem? immo gravissimum. Mobilem? immo constantissimum. Familiarem? immo alienissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 12, 4</bibl>: cum ille dixisset, se vero non exspectare; <cit><quote lang="la">Immo, inquit, rogo exspectes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu? Nullane habes vitia? Immo alia. Et fortasse minora?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36, 3</bibl>.—So in retorting a question: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> <pb n="894" /> <cb n="IMMO" /> Quid apud hasce aedes negotii est tibi? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Immo quid tibi'st? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 29</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> An amabo meretrix illa est, quae illam sustulit? <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Immo meretrix fuit; <cit><quote lang="la">sed ut sit, de ea re eloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 41</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Paucis te volo. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Dictum puta: Nempe ut curentur recte haec. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Immo aliud, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21734.3" n="2" level="3"> Strengthened by edepol, hercle, ecastor, vero, potius, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Ol.</hi> Ecquid amas nunc me? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Immo edepol me quam te minus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 16</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Quod bonum atque fortunatum mihi sit. <hi rend="ital">Ol.</hi> Ita vero et mihi. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Non. <hi rend="ital">Ol.</hi> Immo hercle. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Immo mihi hercle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 5</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Mala es. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Immo ecastor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 33</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Nescis, Parmeno, Quantum hodie profueris mihi, etc. ... <hi rend="ital">Par.</hi> Immo vero scio, neque hoc imprudens feci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? si tyrannidem occupare, si patriam prodere conabitur pater: silebitne filius? Immo vero obsecrabit patrem, ne id faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Sub dio coli absque sole perpetuum diem. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Immo edepol vero, cum, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 79</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Ecquid placent? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Ecquid placeant me rogas? immo hercle vero perplacent, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus haec intelligit, consul videt: hic tamen vivit. Vivit? immo vero etiam in senatum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 43, 1</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Juben' hanc hinc abscedere? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Immo intus potius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo hercle abiero potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vos nihilne attulistis inde auri domum? Immo etiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo vero etiam, v. above: immo est quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an infirmissimi omnium tamquam, quos nuper subjecit, Dolopes? Immo contra ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:51" default="NO">38, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:49" default="NO">41, 3, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21734.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21734.5" n="1" level="3"> As an expression of dislike or surprise (ante-class.): <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Verum vis dicam? <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Immo etiam Narrationis incipit mihi initium, <hi rend="ital">no indeed! now he is going to begin a long story</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idne est verum? immo id est genus hominum pessimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Euge, euge, lepide: laudo commentum tuum. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Ut, si illanc concriminatus sit advorsum Militem, etc. ... <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Immo optume, <hi rend="ital">no! capital!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21734.6" n="2" level="3"> Immo si scias or immo si audias, <hi rend="ital">if you only knew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">had only heard</hi>, intimating that such is not the case (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immo si scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Scelestissimum Me esse credo. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Immo si scias dicta, quae dixit hodie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 64</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bene hercle factum et gaudeo. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Immo si scias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so ellipt.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo si audias Meas pugnas, fugias demissis manibus domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21734.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (perh. not before the Aug. period), for vel potius, in the middle of a sentence, to correct or add emphasis to what has been said, <hi rend="ital">nay rather; nay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I should rather say</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo ita sit,</quote> <trans><tr>nay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra deum, deos immo ipsos convulsos ex sedibus suis ablatos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:48:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 48, 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse aliquid, immo multa quotidie dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:10" default="NO">6, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:85:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 85, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pauculis diebus gestum consulatum, immo non gestum abiciebant per edictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil causae est, cur non illam vocis modulationem fidibus ac tibiis, immo hercle, cymbalis adjuvemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—In forming a climax: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta verborum nobis paupertas, immo egestas sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippinam nihilo tractabiliorem, immo in dies amentiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23, 2</bibl>.!*? Rarely after a word in the clause (first in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil immo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non immo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non habet immo suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:94:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 94, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivit immo vigetque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statueretur immo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frueretur immo his,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam immo virtutes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos quin immo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam quin immo curam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin immo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:27" default="NO">12, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:8" default="NO">7, 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immobilis: <entryFree id="n21735" type="main" key="immo_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immōbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-mobilis</etym>, <sense id="n21735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immovable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21735.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21735.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra immobilis manens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephas tardum et paene immobile animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balaenae ad flexum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 101</bibl></cit>: <cb n="IMMO" /> immobilior scopulis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 801</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21735.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>immovable property</tr>, <tr>real estate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 8, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:23" default="NO">41, 3, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. res mobiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 19, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21735.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmoved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ardet inexcita Ausonia atque immobilis ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec princeps immobilem se precibus et invidiae juxta ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum plausum ac lasciviam insultantis vulgi immobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti apathiae sectatores, qui videri se esse tranquillos et intrepidos et immobiles volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua pro rostris cum hac inscriptione: PIETATIS IMMOBILIS ERGA PRINCIPEM,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae mensurā continentur, certa et immobilia congruere sibi debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 34" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immobilitas: <entryFree id="n21736" type="main" key="immo_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immōbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immobilis</etym>, <sense id="n21736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immovableness</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n21736.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae (maris mortui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:195" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 195</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21736.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unfeelingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of feeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immoderantia: <entryFree id="n21737" type="main" key="immo^de^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĕrantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inmoderor</etym>, <sense id="n21737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventris (opp. abstinentia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
immoderate: <entryFree id="n21738" type="main" key="immo^de^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immoderatus <sense id="n21738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immoderatio: <entryFree id="n21739" type="main" key="immo^de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĕrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immoderatus</etym>, <sense id="n21739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">efferri immoderatione verborum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exaggerated expressions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: potūs, Ambros. de Elia et Jejun. 12, 44. —</sense><sense id="n21739.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhythm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem mensuram et modum immoderationi anteponi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Music. 9</bibl></cit>, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
immoderatus: <entryFree id="n21740" type="main" key="immo^de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-moderatus</etym>, <sense id="n21740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measureless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immeasurable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21740.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): vides sublime, fusum, immoderatum aethera, <hi rend="ital">unbounded</hi> (= immensum), Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 25, 65; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1013" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1013</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21740.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum illum Aristotelis discipulum, superbum, crudelem, immoderatum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et turbulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensae cupiditates, infinitae et immoderatae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
