Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemperantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe duos pro uno dominos acceptos, inmoderata, infinita potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res immoderata cupido est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animi, cum immoderatiores sunt, vitia fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoderatissimae luxuriae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoderato potu et pastu pars animi obstupefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne immoderata aut angusta sit oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 198</bibl></cit>: vox immoderatior, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 51</bibl>: tam immoderatae linguae fuit, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi>, Suet. Vit. Luc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĕrātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n21740.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">without measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri immoderate et fortuitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox immoderate profusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effunditur spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21740.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abuti nostra facilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre casum incommodorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immodeste: <entryFree id="n21741" type="main" key="immo^deste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immodestus <sense id="n21741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immodestia: <entryFree id="n21742" type="main" key="immo^desti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdestĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immodestus</etym>, <sense id="n21742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intemperate conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immodesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">licentiousness</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): heri haec immodestia me coëgit, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanorum,</quote> <trans><tr>avarice</tr>, <tr>extortion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immodestus: <entryFree id="n21743" type="main" key="immo^destus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmodestus</etym>, <sense id="n21743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi> (rare but class.; syn. immoderatus): in vino. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitione effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fautores histrionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: genus jocandi non profusum nec immodestum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdestē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n21743.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriari (with immodice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodeste atque intemperanter facere multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare missionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21743.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unjustly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me hoc indecore, inmodeste datis di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>. <cb n="IMMO" /></sense></entryFree>
immodice: <entryFree id="n21744" type="main" key="immo^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immodicus <sense id="n21744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immodicus: <entryFree id="n21745" type="main" key="immo^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in modicus</etym>, <sense id="n21745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond bounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unruly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n21745.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">prominet immodicum pro longa cuspide rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:808" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">continuae et immodicae tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 47</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n21745.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">immodicus in numero augendo esse solet,</quote> <trans><tr>is in the habit of exaggerating numbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in appetendis honoribus immodicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodicus linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 114</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tum verbis tum rebus immodicus,</quote> <trans><tr>extravagant in words and deeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchi legibus (ferendis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 796</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus potius quam immodicus (praeceptor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">licentia crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta ad honores sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido possidendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi acclamationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>too long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21745.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiae et maeroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodica cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏ-dĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">beyond measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sanguis ex vulnere immodice fluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 38, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucata formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequenter id potius quam immodice facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunae positae (figurae) cum immodice petantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodesteque gloriari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi arrogare eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere voluptatem ex aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immodulatus: <entryFree id="n21746" type="hapax" key="immo^du^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏdŭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-modulatus</etym>, <sense id="n21746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrhythmical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inharmonious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immoenis: <entryFree id="n21747" type="main" key="immoenis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immoenis</orth>, v. immunis.</entryFree>
immolaticius: <entryFree id="n21748" type="main" key="immo^la_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏlātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>immolo</etym>, <sense id="n21748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for a sacrifice</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 154" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 154</bibl></cit>; cf.: immolaticius <foreign lang="greek">qu/simos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
immolatio: <entryFree id="n21749" type="main" key="immo^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏlātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacrifice</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso immolationis tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iphigeniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 13</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21749.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 36:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 36, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immolator: <entryFree id="n21750" type="main" key="immo^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏlātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who offers a sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacrificer</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut se exta ad immolatoris fortunam accommodent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nati immolator unici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immolitus: <entryFree id="n21751" type="main" key="immo_li_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immōlītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [inmolior], <sense id="n21751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">built up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">erected</hi> in a place (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quae in loca publica inaedificata immolitave privati habebant ... demoliti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44, 4</bibl></cit>; so, INAEDIFICATVM INMOLITVMVE, Tab. Heracl. l. 70.</sense></entryFree>
immolo: <entryFree id="n21752" type="main" key="immo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inmola</etym>. <sense id="n21752.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">to sprinkle</hi> a victim <hi rend="ital">with sacrificial meal</hi> (mola salsa): <cit><quote lang="la">olim hostiae immolatae dicebantur mola salsa tactae, cum vero ictae et aliquid ex illis in aram datum, mactatae dicebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—So only in one other example in Cato: boves immolati, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 541</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n21752.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring as an offering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immolate</hi> (cf. macto): <cit><quote lang="la">ego hodie dis meis iratissumis sex agnos immolavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musis bovem immolasse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae vitulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">agnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pro victimis homines immolant aut se immolaturos vovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Front. 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hominem immolaverint, exve ejus sanguine litaverint, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 16</bibl></cit>: porca, quae Cereri immolatur, Veran. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sulla immolaret ante praetorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: nemo nostrum est, quin, etiam cum de alia re immolaret, tamen, etc., Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum immolanti aufugisset hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 95</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>:<pb n="895" /> <cb n="IMMO" />  cum pluribus dis immolatur, Civ. Div. 2, 17, 38.—With <case>abl.</case> of the offering: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus hostiis immolandum cuique deo, cui majoribus, cui lactentibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: itaque Jovi tauro, verre, ariete immolari non licet, Capit. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 10, 3</bibl>; cf. ib. § 4.—</sense><sense id="n21752.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in a still more general sense, <hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas te hoc vulnere, Pallas Immolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:949" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 949</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferias quos (juvenes) immolet umbris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 519</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21752.3" n="C" level="2"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">To present as an offering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilitatem animae suae deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitentiam deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pudic. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui populus suffragiis immolat,</quote> <trans><tr>does homage to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Anim. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immoranter: <entryFree id="n21753" type="gloss" key="immo^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏranter</orth>, <itype>incunctanter</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">a)nuperqe/tws</foreign> (<sense id="n21753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
immordeo: <entryFree id="n21754" type="main" key="immorde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immordĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inmordeo</etym>, <sense id="n21754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bite into</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare; perh. only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">labitur, immorsaque cadens obmutuit hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:628" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immorso aequales videant mea vulnera collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">(stomachus) pernā magis ac magis hillis Flagitat immorsus refici (= vellicatus, excitatus),</quote> <trans><tr>excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immorior: <entryFree id="n21755" type="main" key="immo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏrĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>mortuus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n21755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [in-morior], <hi rend="ital">to die in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose).—Constr. with <case>dat.</case> and rarely <hi rend="ital">in aliqua re.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21755.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa sorori immoritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:570" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter Euxinis aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 7, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellio immortuus vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 22, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes immortuae in melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 128</bibl></cit>: non exigo, ut immoriaris legationi, immorare, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:34:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe tormentis pro silentio rerum creditarum immortui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">manus immortua,</quote> <trans><tr>dying</tr>, <tr>withering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura superstes Immoritur velis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dies away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:481" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 481</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n21755.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: immoritur studiis (<case>dat.</case> = macerat et enecat se opere rustico exercendo), <hi rend="ital">he pines away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immoror: <entryFree id="n21756" type="main" key="immo^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŏror</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n21756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [in-moror], <hi rend="ital">to tarry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stay upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to linger near</hi> a place (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n21756.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re, alicul rei): ut saturae studiosius nidis immorentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer meridiano inmorans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21756.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne terrenis immorer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestis cogitationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: non exigo, ut immoriaris legationi, immorare, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non arbitror mihi in hoc immorandum, quid sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immorsus: <entryFree id="n21757" type="main" key="immorsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immorsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from immordeo.</entryFree>
immortalis: <entryFree id="n21758" type="main" key="immorta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immortālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-mortalis</etym>, <sense id="n21758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immortal</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21758.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullum corpus immortale sit, nullum esse corpus sempiternum: corpus autem immortale nullum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo deos immortales sparsisse animos in corpora humana, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: dii; <cit><quote lang="la">v. deus: animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura (opp. mortalis fortuna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro di inmortales!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deorum inmortalium!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immortāles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the immortals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gods</hi>: quod ad immortales attinet, haec; <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps quod ad mortales,</quote> <trans><tr>to the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 75</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 165</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21758.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21758.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Imperishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria et gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam alicujus reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum cepi vestri in me amoris et judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: gratias agere alicui, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Sallustii velocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo ignaviā immortalis factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalia ne speres, monet annus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21758.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">like the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly happy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalis ero, si altera talis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. 14 (3, 6), 10; 2, 15 (3, 7), 39.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immortā-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">infinitely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immortalitas: <entryFree id="n21759" type="main" key="immorta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immortālĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immortalis</etym>, <sense id="n21759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exemption from death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immortality</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21759.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvos sum: inmortalitas mihi datast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: quae Socrates supremo vitae die de immortalitate animorum disseruisset, Cic. de <cb n="IMMU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:21:78" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 21, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita beata nullā aliā re nisi immortalitate cedens caelestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. D. 2:61:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 61, 153</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide igitur, ne virtutibus hominum isti honores habeantur, non immortalitatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to their immortal natures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21759.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21759.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Imperishableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperishable fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undying renown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immortality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non censet lugendam esse mortem, quam immortalitas consequatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum inmortalitatis virtute partae fautor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emit morte immortalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi populus Romanus aeternitatem immortalitatemque donavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid immortalitati commendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid immortalitati tradere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 60</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n21759.4" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to immortalis, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Blessedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the height of happiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi immortalitas parta est, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immortaliter: <entryFree id="n21760" type="hapax" key="immorta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immortālĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immortalis <sense id="n21760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immortalitus: <entryFree id="n21761" type="hapax" key="immorta_li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immortālĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>immortalis, analog. with divinitus</etym>, <sense id="n21761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the gift of the gods</hi>: immortalitus se obtulit mihi haec facultas, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 28</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 89 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
immortuus: <entryFree id="n21762" type="main" key="immortu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immortŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from immorior.</entryFree>
immotus: <entryFree id="n21763" type="main" key="immo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immōtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-motus</etym>, <sense id="n21763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmoved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motionless</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n21763.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(illa arbor) immota manet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ceres) Sub Jove duravit multis immota diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:505" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia (opp. mobilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">158: aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 36, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum examina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenus et immotus dies,</quote> <trans><tr>calm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum pondus sedet immotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21763.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unmoved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unshaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens immota manet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manent immota tuorum Fata tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 257</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immota manet fatis Lavinia conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immotas praebet mugitibus aures,</quote> <trans><tr>unmoved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha procis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:112" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus turmas acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 55, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immotus iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immota aut modice lacessita pax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:598" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicis animi immota tranquillitas, Sen. de Ira, 2, 12, 6: constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Const. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Vit. Beat. 4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17, 22</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi non animo fixum immotumque sederet, Ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>immovable</tr>, <tr>unchangeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immotum adversus eos sermones fixumque Tiberio fuit non omittere caput rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immugio: <entryFree id="n21764" type="main" key="immu_gio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūgio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>inmugio</etym>, <sense id="n21764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roar</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">resound in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">curvisque immugiit Aetna cavernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procella Antennae immugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:257" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestoque immugit regia luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicaturo Domino lugubre mundus immugiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immulgeo: <entryFree id="n21765" type="main" key="immulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immulgĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-mulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n21765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to milk into</hi>: lacteam opem, Liv. And. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=163" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 163</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 38 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">teneris immulgens ubera labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dolore (oculi) et epiphoris si immulgeatur (lac), plurimum prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immundabilis: <entryFree id="n21766" type="hapax" key="immunda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immundābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmundo</etym>, <sense id="n21766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be cleansed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immunde: <entryFree id="n21767" type="main" key="immunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immundus <sense id="n21767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immunditia: <entryFree id="n21768" type="main" key="immundi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immundĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immundus</etym>, <sense id="n21768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncleanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 6</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">immundĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mon. 7</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:8" default="NO">12, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 23, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continet se a viis nostris, quasi ab immunditiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immundo: <entryFree id="n21769" type="main" key="immundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immundo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render unclean</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">albentes pulvere canes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Carm. 8, 589</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immundus: <entryFree id="n21770" type="main" key="immundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inmundus</etym>, <sense id="n21770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unclean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi> (syn.: spurcus, obscenus, impurus). </sense><sense id="n21770.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): humus erat immunda, lutulenta vino, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1</bibl>, <cb n="IMMU" /> 115; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpyiae contactu immundo omnia foedant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans><tr>run wild</tr>, <tr>overgrown</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies domūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 199</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-mundae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">unclean women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superne deciduo immundiore lapsu aliquo polluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 23, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nilo mundius hoc, niloque immundior ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 9, 4, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquet illos immundissimos fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:98:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 98, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n21770.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut immunda crepent ignominiosaque dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 247</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncleanly</hi>: foedare templa, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> Prod. 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immunificus: <entryFree id="n21771" type="hapax" key="immu_ni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūnĭfĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-munificus</etym>, <sense id="n21771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not liberal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stingy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immunio: <entryFree id="n21772" type="hapax" key="immu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūnĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>īvi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n21772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium immunivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immunis: <entryFree id="n21773" type="main" key="immu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūnis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth> and archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-moenis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-munus</etym>, <sense id="n21773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exempt from a public service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burāen</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">charge</hi> (class.; cf.: expers, exsors). </sense><sense id="n21773.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius hi quam nos, qui piratas immunes, socios vectigales habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid immunes? hi certe nihil debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine foedere immunes civitates ac liberae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>, § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunis militiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilienses ab omni onere immunes praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui agros immunes liberosque arant, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>free from taxes</tr>, <tr>tax-free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 166</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo milia jugerum Sexto Clodio rhetori assignasti, et quidem immunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21773.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunes portoriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterorum immunes nisi propulsandi hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 36</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21773.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the polit. and milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exempt from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that contributes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gives nothing</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non cnim est inhumana virtus neque immunis neque superba,</quote> <trans><tr>inactive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem scis inmunem Cinarae placuisse rapaci,</quote> <trans><tr>who made no presents</tr>, <tr>without presents</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 12, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Enipeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunisque sedens aliena ad pabula fucus,</quote> <trans><tr>doing nothing</tr>, <tr>idle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa quoque immunis rastroque intacta,</quote> <trans><tr>without compulsion</tr>, <tr>free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 101</bibl></cit>.—In a play on the word: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Civi inmuni scin quid cantari solet? ... <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Verum, gnate mi, is est inmunis, quoi nihil est qui munus fungatur suum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21773.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos curvi immunis aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunes operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21773.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not sharing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">partaking in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21773.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicit urbem Immunem tanti belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necis,</quote> <trans><tr>exempt from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis manus,</quote> <trans><tr>free from</tr>, <tr>unstained with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictorum paternorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequoris Arctos,</quote> <trans><tr>not setting in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 293</bibl></cit> (an imitation of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">a)/mmoros loetrw=n *)wkeanoi=o</foreign>, Il. 18, 489); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:575" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 575</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21773.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum immunem esse tristitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato omnibus humanis vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum immunem tanta calamitate servavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 120, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21773.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunis ab omnibus arbitris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes a dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21773.9" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunis aram si tetigit manus,</quote> <trans><tr>stainless</tr>, <tr>pure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum castigare ob meritam noxiam, Inmoenest facinus,</quote> <trans><tr>a thankless office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: inmoene, improbum, culpandum, vel interdum munere liberatum, Gloss. Plac. p. 476.</sense></entryFree>
immunitas: <entryFree id="n21774" type="main" key="immu_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n21774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> immunitatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 35</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immunis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">freedom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exemption from public services</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdens</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">charges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immunity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21774.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: (Druides) militiae vacationem omniumque rerum habent immunitatem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunitas et libertas provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunitatem (a tributis) obtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 15</bibl>: personae quibus decimae immunitatem ipse (imperator) tribuit, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 16, 9, 3 et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 1</bibl>, <pb n="896" /> <cb n="IMMU" /> 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21774.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">freedom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exemption</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">immunity</hi> from any thing (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vacatio, vacuitas): qui det isti deo immunitatem magni muneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunitates malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immunitus: <entryFree id="n21775" type="main" key="immu_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūnītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-munitus</etym>, <sense id="n21775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfortified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefended</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oppida castellaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sparte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermes atque immuniti abscondimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not properly made</tr>, <tr>impassable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immurmuro: <entryFree id="n21776" type="main" key="immurmu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immurmŭro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>inmurmuro</etym>, <sense id="n21776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to murmur in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa jacet terraeque tremens immurmurat atrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:567" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvis Auster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:332" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita aure (Acestae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:532" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa sibi introrsum et sub lingua immurmurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpor a cunctis totumque immurmurat agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse publicato nobis, quod immurmurat,</quote> <trans><tr>whispers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepe immurmurantes audierit ventos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 12, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immusicus: <entryFree id="n21777" type="main" key="immu_si^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūsĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inmusicus</etym>, <sense id="n21777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmusical</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immussulus: <entryFree id="n21778" type="main" key="immussu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immussŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">immusŭlus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vulture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falcon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 7, 8, § 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21778.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sea-eagle</hi> = ossifraga, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 112 and 113 Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immutabilis: <entryFree id="n21779" type="main" key="immu_ta_bi^lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-mutabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutable</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">esse causas immutabiles easque aeternas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">immutabilis et aeterna res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magis immutabile ex vero in falsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (with stabilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensio (with stabilis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem ratio, quae fuit futuraque, donec res eaedem manebunt, inmutabilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus verborum (with grave),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:212" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 212</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordi populo nihil esse immutabilius, nihil firmius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unchangeably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:99:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 99, § 1</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 74.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21780" type="main" key="immu_ta_bi^lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>immuto</etym>, <sense id="n21780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitus atque ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immutabiliores animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Anim. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immutabilitas: <entryFree id="n21781" type="hapax" key="immu_ta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtābĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. immutabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in factis immutabilitatem apparere, in futuris non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immutabiliter: <entryFree id="n21782" type="main" key="immu_ta_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. immutabilis <sense id="n21782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
immutatio: <entryFree id="n21783" type="main" key="immu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>immuto</etym>, <sense id="n21783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exchanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substitution of one thing for another</hi> in speech: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 176</bibl></cit>: si verborum immutationibus utantur, quos appellant <foreign lang="greek">tro/pous</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21783.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">metonymy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the indirect naming</hi> of any thing = <foreign lang="greek">a)lloiwsis, metwnumi/a</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">immutationes nusquam crebriores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>metonymies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl>: faciebat barbarismos immutatione, cum <hi rend="ital">c</hi> pro <hi rend="ital">g</hi> uteretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immutator: <entryFree id="n21784" type="main" key="immu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a changer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
immutatus: <entryFree id="n21785" type="main" key="immu_ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-mutatus</etym>, <sense id="n21785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchanged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaltered</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">id mutavit, quia me immutatum videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas est, per quam immutata ea, quae sunt aut ante fuerunt aut futura sunt, dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n21786" type="main" key="immu_ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from immuto.</entryFree>
immutesco: <entryFree id="n21787" type="main" key="immu_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūtesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>tŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n21787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-mutesco], <hi rend="ital">to become dumb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">speechless</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">immutescamus alioqui, si nihil dicendum videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptis ore querelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:542" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 542</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
immutilatus: <entryFree id="n21788" type="hapax" key="immu^ti^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŭtĭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-mutilo</etym>, <sense id="n21788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">maimed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilated</hi>: corpore, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 366, 18</bibl> (Hist. 4, 40 Dietsch).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21789" type="hapax" key="immu^ti^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immŭtĭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-mutilatus</etym>, <sense id="n21789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmutilated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, Cod. Th. 4, 22, 1.</sense></entryFree>
immuto: <entryFree id="n21790" type="main" key="immu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">immūto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n21790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> inmutarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 40</bibl>; <cb n="IMPA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 29</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-muto</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21790.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi immutatus sum? ubi ego formam perdidi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 300</bibl></cit>: perscrutari ... nos nostri an alieni simus; <cit><quote lang="la">ne clam quispiam nos imprudentis mmutaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeone homines inmutarier ex amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum earum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio, potestate, prosperis rebus immutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me aliquando immutarunt tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: illi regi amabili Cyro subest ad immutandi animi licentiam crudelissimus ille Phalaris (v. <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ejus orbis (i. e. signiferi) unaquaeque pars alia alio modo moveat immutetque caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentus immutatus aut discrepans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: temeritas filii comprobavit; <cit><quote lang="la">verborum ordinem immuta: fac sic: comprobavit filii temeritas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 63, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen immuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum successor aliquid immutat de institutis priorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21790.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in rhet. </sense><sense id="n21790.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by metonymy</hi>, one word for another: <cit><quote lang="la">immutata (verba), in quibus pro verbo proprio subicitur aliud, quod idem significet, sumptum ex re aliqua consequenti, etc. ... Ennius Horridam Africam terribili tremere tumultu cum dicit, pro Afris immutat Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 92 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21790.4" n="(b)" level="5"> E s p.: immutata oratio, <hi rend="ital">allegory</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgori/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 261</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imo: <entryFree id="n21791" type="main" key="i_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īmo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. immo.</entryFree>
