impacatus: <entryFree id="n21792" type="main" key="impa_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impācātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpacatus</etym>, <sense id="n21792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not peaceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquiet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aut impacatos a tergo horrebis Iberos,</quote> <trans><tr>warlike</tr>, <tr>plundering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:137" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 137</bibl></cit>: quies alti pelagi, Claud. in. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 70</bibl>: vita, Sen. de Ira, 3, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: odia, Claud. in. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impacificus: <entryFree id="n21793" type="main" key="impa_ci^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impācĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-pax-facio</etym>, <sense id="n21793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not inclined to peace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 43, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impactio: <entryFree id="n21794" type="hapax" key="impacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impactĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impingo</etym>, <sense id="n21794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concussion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
impactus: <entryFree id="n21795" type="main" key="impactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impingo.</entryFree>
impaene: <entryFree id="n21796" type="main" key="impaene"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impaene</orth>, v. impunis, II.</entryFree>
impaenitendus: <entryFree id="n21797" type="hapax" key="impaeni^tendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impaenĭtendus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-paenitet</etym>, <sense id="n21797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be repented of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impaenitens: <entryFree id="n21798" type="main" key="impaeni^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impaenĭtens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpaenitens</etym>, <sense id="n21798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not repenting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impenitent</hi> (late Lat.): cor, Hier. in. Iesai. 12, 40, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impaenitentia: <entryFree id="n21799" type="main" key="impaeni^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impaenĭtentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inpaenitentia</etym>, <sense id="n21799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impenitence</hi> (late Lat.), Hier. in. Iesai. 18, 65, 23.</sense></entryFree>
impaenitus: <entryFree id="n21800" type="main" key="impaeni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impaenītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), v. impunitus.</entryFree>
impages: <entryFree id="n21801" type="main" key="impa_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impāges</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-pag, pango; analogous with compages</etym>, <sense id="n21801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the border</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frame-work which surrounds the panel of a door</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>; cf.: impages dicuntur quae a fabris in tabulis figuntur, quo firmius cohaereant, a pangendo, id est figere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
impallesco: <entryFree id="n21802" type="main" key="impallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impallesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n21802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-pallesco], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn pale in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> any thing (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnis chartis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:62" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventu impalluit ipse secundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:805" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 805</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impalpebratio: <entryFree id="n21803" type="main" key="impalpe^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impalpĕbrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inpalpebrae</etym>, <sense id="n21803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loss of motion in the eyelids</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:5:87" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 5, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impar: <entryFree id="n21804" type="main" key="impar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impar</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ăris</itype> (<sense id="n21804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> impari; <cit><quote lang="la">but, metri grat., impare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 372</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> imparium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4 al.</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-par</etym>, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unequal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilar</hi> in number or quality (cf. dispar, dissimilis). </sense><sense id="n21804.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum numerus par an impar sit, nescitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congressus impari numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero deus impare gaudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 75</bibl></cit> Serv.; cf.: imparem numerum antiqui prosperiorem hominibus esse crediderunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sonus) intervallis conjunctus imparibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Musas amat impares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imparibus carmina facta modis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hexameters and pentameters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:220" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 220</bibl></cit>: impares tibiae numero foraminum discretae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere par impar,</quote> <trans><tr>even or odd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 248</bibl></cit>: mensae <cb n="IMPA" /> erat pes tertius impar: <cit><quote lang="la">Testa parem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae atque animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si toga dissidet impar, Rides,</quote> <trans><tr>uneven</tr>, <tr>awry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer coloribus impar,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>partycolored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos quidem ego ambo unice diligo: sed in Marco benevolentia impari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exhortationem praecipue valent imparia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil fuit umquam sic impar sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (with the accessory notion of smaller, inferior), <hi rend="ital">unequal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a match for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unable to cope with</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaker</hi> (so perh. not till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n21804.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phthius Achilles, Ceteris major, tibi (Apollini) miles impar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">derepente velut impar dolori congemuit,</quote> <trans><tr>unable to support his grief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebre corpus impar dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senex et levissimis quoque curis impar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pygmaeus bellator impar hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimatium conspirationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum ardori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impar tantis honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. specif.</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed viribus impar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 610</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">par audaciā Romanus, consilio et viribus impar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni parte virium impar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec facies impar nobilitate fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:306" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Batavi impares numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsessi et impares et aqua ciboque defecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta impari,</quote> <trans><tr>to an inferior in rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pater consularis, avus praetorius, maternum genus impar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Julia Tiberium spreverat ut imparem,</quote> <trans><tr>not her equal in birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul odiorum invidiaeque erga Fabium Valentem admonebatur, ut inpar apud Vitellium gratiam viresque apud novum principem pararet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inequitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbam quam inpar esset sors, cum ille vobis bellum pararet, vos ei securam pacem praestaretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">unequal</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beyond one's strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which one is not a match for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judice sub Tmolo certamen venit ad impar,</quote> <trans><tr>to the unequal strife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 216</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imparibus certare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21804.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum opus et tangi nisi cura vincitur impar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 61</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impărĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unequally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versibus impariter junctis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in hexameters and pentameters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imparatio: <entryFree id="n21805" type="hapax" key="impa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impărātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inparo</etym>, <sense id="n21805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigestion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
imparatus: <entryFree id="n21806" type="main" key="impa^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impărātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inparatus</etym>, <sense id="n21806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprovided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfurnished</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne imparatus sim, si adveniat Phormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Antonius) imparatus semper aggredi ad dicendum videbatur: sed ita erat paratus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam paratus in imparatos Clodius inciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermem atque imparatum adoriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ipsum incautum atque etiam imparatum incideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imparati cum a militibus, tum a pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inops ipse rerum omnium atque imparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve tempus longum est imparatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae facient hanc rem mihi ex parata imparatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus imparatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
imparcenter: <entryFree id="n21807" type="main" key="imparcenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imparcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>in-parcus</etym>, <sense id="n21807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relentlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsparingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta perdit, Hilar. in Job, 1, 76: Samson in mortem tradidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 90.</sense></entryFree>
imparentem: <entryFree id="n21808" type="gloss" key="impa_rentem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impārentem</orth> <itype>non parentem hoc est obedientem</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
imparentia: <entryFree id="n21809" type="spur" key="impa_renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impārentĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">impārĭentĭa</orth>, false read. for impatientia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl>.</entryFree>
imparilis: <entryFree id="n21810" type="main" key="impa^ri^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impărĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-parilis</etym>, <sense id="n21810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unequal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 14:9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impărĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unequally</hi>, Aug. Quest. ap. Hept. 2, 177, 3.</sense></entryFree>
imparilitas: <entryFree id="n21811" type="main" key="impa^ri^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impărĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imparilis</etym>, <sense id="n21811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inequality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difference</hi> (very rare): imparilitas haec turbat observationem omnisque ratio disciplinae confunditur, <hi rend="ital">lack of</hi> <pb n="897" /> <cb n="IMPA" /> <hi rend="ital">correspondence</hi> between the situations of the stars and the varied fates of men, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21811.1" n="II" level="1"> Gram. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">soloecismus Latino vocabulo a Sinnio Capitone ejusdemque aetatis aliis imparilitas appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impariter: <entryFree id="n21812" type="main" key="impa^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impărĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impar <sense id="n21812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impartibilis: <entryFree id="n21813" type="main" key="imparti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impartĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-partibilis</etym>, <sense id="n21813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impartio: <entryFree id="n21814" type="main" key="imparti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impartĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. impertio.</entryFree>
impascor: <entryFree id="n21815" type="main" key="impascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impascor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>sci</itype>, <sense id="n21815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass.</hi> [in-pasco], <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be pastured in</hi> a place (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca, quibus nullum impascitur pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:1" default="NO">2, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impassibilis: <entryFree id="n21816" type="main" key="impassi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impassĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-passibilis</etym>, <sense id="n21816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incapable of passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionless</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 84</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impassĭbĭ-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without passion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impassibilitas: <entryFree id="n21817" type="main" key="impassi^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impassĭbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impassibilis</etym>, <sense id="n21817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incapacity for suffering;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)pa/qeia</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 133, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impassibiliter: <entryFree id="n21818" type="main" key="impassi^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impassĭbĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impassibilis <sense id="n21818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impastus: <entryFree id="n21819" type="main" key="impastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impastus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpastus</etym>, <sense id="n21819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hungry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 628</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impatibilis: <entryFree id="n21820" type="main" key="impa^ti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impătĭbĭlis</orth>, v. impetibilis.</entryFree>
impatiens: <entryFree id="n21821" type="main" key="impa^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impătĭens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpatiens</etym>. <sense id="n21821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will not endure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi> of any thing (not ante-Aug.; cf. intolerans). </sense><sense id="n21821.1" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings; usu. constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21821.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 322</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miles impatiens solis, pulveris, tempestatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:4" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger morā et spei impatiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longioris sollicitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">impatiens expersque viri,</quote> <trans><tr>not enduring</tr>, <tr>avoiding</tr>, <tr>fleeing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:288" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nympharum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ab impatientibus remediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:296" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: irae, <hi rend="ital">impatient in his wrath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ungovernably furious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli flagrantes ira, cujus impatiens gens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues ex omnibus pecudibus impatientissimae famis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius quietis impatientissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:23:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21821.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibere furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:98" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescire torum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21821.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est impatientius imperitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impatientissima sollicitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21821.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus laborum impatiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera impatiens caloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aesculus umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 57, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis gubernaculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 866</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solum Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae lactis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that cannot restrain their milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 32, § 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisum impatientissimum frigorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 31, § 123</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21821.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That does not feel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apathetic</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 22, 5</bibl>.—Esp., philos. t. t., of the Stoics, <hi rend="ital">free from sensibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without feeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus et hi, quibus summum bonum visum est animus impatiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impătĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impatiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">amavi juvenem tam ardenter quam nunc impatienter requiro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 3</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 22, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impatienter: <entryFree id="n21822" type="main" key="impa^ti^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impătĭenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impatiens <sense id="n21822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impatientia: <entryFree id="n21823" type="main" key="impa^ti^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impătĭentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impatiens</etym>. <sense id="n21823.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unwillingness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inability to bear</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">want of endurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impatience</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n21823.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nauseae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas extrema, fessa mente, retinet silentii impatientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>impatience</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21823.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ipse visendo ejus tormenta ad impatientiam dilaberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa impatientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21823.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Insensibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apathy</hi>, as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)pa/qeia</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl>. <cb n="IMPE" /></sense></entryFree>
impausabilis: <entryFree id="n21824" type="main" key="impausa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impausābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpausa</etym>, <sense id="n21824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unceasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessant</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*)alhktw\</foreign> Graece impausabilis dicitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impausābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unceasingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere cibum,</quote> <trans><tr>without ceasing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impavide: <entryFree id="n21825" type="main" key="impa^vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impăvĭdē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impavidus <sense id="n21825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impavidus: <entryFree id="n21826" type="main" key="impa^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impăvĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpavidus</etym>, <sense id="n21826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undaunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepid</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): ludere pendentes pueros et lambere matrem Impavidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fractus illabatur orbis, Impavidum ferient ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucer et Sthenelus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gradivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 78, § 258</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:196" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 81, 83, § 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 59, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:840" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 840</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impăvĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhausto poculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impeccabilis: <entryFree id="n21827" type="hapax" key="impecca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impeccābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpecco</etym>, <sense id="n21827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faultless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impeccable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impeccantia: <entryFree id="n21828" type="main" key="impeccanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impeccantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inpecco</etym>, <sense id="n21828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faultlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinlessness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Pelag. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
impedatio: <entryFree id="n21829" type="main" key="impe^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impedo</etym>, <sense id="n21829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporting with props</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impedico: <entryFree id="n21830" type="hapax" key="impe^di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pedica</etym>, <sense id="n21830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impedimentum: <entryFree id="n21831" type="main" key="impe^di_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdīmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (archaic form ‡ impelimenta impedimenta dicebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.; cf. the letter D), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>impedio</etym>, <sense id="n21831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that by which one is entangled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impeded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impediment</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: obstaculum, difficultas). </sense><sense id="n21831.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">compeditos primo aegre ferre onera et impedimenta crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes impedimenta naturae diligentia industriaque superavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram atque impedimentum alicui inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentum magis quam auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam jam recepisse te colligo, nam festinanti tabellario dedi: nisi quid impedimenti in via passus est,</quote> <trans><tr>hinderance</tr>, <tr>delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse impedimenti loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum impedimento esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with ad,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">impedimento esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:123" default="NO">5, 10, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl> praef. § 2 et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallis magno ad pugnam erat impedimento, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dictatori religio impedimento ad rem gerendam fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21831.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <number>plur.</number> impedimenta; concr., <hi rend="ital">travelling equipage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luggage;</hi> and esp. in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the baggage</hi> of an army (including the beasts of burden and their drivers; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinae): nullis impedimentis, nullis Graecis comitibus (opp. magno et impedito comitatu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad impedimenta et carros suos se contulerunt ... Ad multam noctem etiam ad impedimenta pugnatum est ... impedimentis castrisque nostri potiti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta in unum locum contulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentis direptis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 24, 3 et saep.: prima luce magnum numerum impedimentorum ex castris mulorumque produci eque iis stramenta detrahi jubet,</quote> <trans><tr>pack-horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfectis omnibus impedimentis ad pugnam descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impedio: <entryFree id="n21832" type="main" key="impe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n21832.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inque peditur, inque pediri, inque peditus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 394</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:484" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 484</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:562" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 562</bibl>; 1149), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pes; cf. compedes; lit., to entangle the feet; hence, in gen.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensnare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hamper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold fast</hi> (cf.: praepedio, implico, illigo, irretio, illaqueo). </sense><sense id="n21832.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">impediunt teneros vincula nulla pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 410</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et illis crura quoque impediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsus illic sese jam impedivit in plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (silva) retentis impeditus (cervus) cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedita cassibus dama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: reti impedit Pisces, <hi rend="ital">ensnares</hi>, <cb n="IMPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21832.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">narrare parantem Impedit amplexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc decet aut viridi nitidum caput impedire myrto Aut flore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines (vitta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua sertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 868</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos (hederae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium crus pellibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos frenis,</quote> <trans><tr>to bridle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:736" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 736</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem clipeum informant ... septenosque orbibus orbes Impediunt,</quote> <trans><tr>surround</tr>, <tr>encircle each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes orbibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plana novo munimenti genere (with saepire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochus, castris positis, munitionibus insuper saltum impediebat,</quote> <trans><tr>rendered difficult of access</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21832.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21832.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrass</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">impeditum in ea (re amatoria) expedivi animum meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis est, cum stultitia sua impeditus sit, quoquo modo possit se expedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse te impedies, ipse tua defensione implicabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me et se hisce impedivit nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum alios servat, se impedivit interim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot me impediunt curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21832.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi> (so most freq.; cf.: inhibeo, prohibeo, interdico, veto); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliqua re</hi>, or the simple <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> very rarely with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n21832.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quotidie aliud ex alio impedit: sed si me expediero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis studiis sic impediuntur, ut, etc. ... discendi enim studio impediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate et morbo impeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 63</bibl></cit>: religione impediri, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte qua re impediar atque alliger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—With inanim: <cit><quote lang="la">or abstr. objects: sinistra impedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea dubitatio aut impedire profectionem meam videbatur aut certe tardare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigationem (Corus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas utilitates amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res magnas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli rationem prope jam explicatam perturbare atque impedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quod si corporis gravioribus morbis vitae jucunditas impeditur; <cit><quote lang="la">quanto magis animi morbis impediri necesse est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21832.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliqua re</hi> or the simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi non fuisse dubium, a re publica bene gerenda impediri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab delectatione omni negotiis impedimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 19, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a suo munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a vero bonoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non oportere sese a populo Romano in suo jure impediri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem dignitas fugā impediverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21832.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quominus.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id in hac disputatione de fato casus quidam, ne facerem, impedivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 33, 92</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla re impedirer, quin, si vellem, mihi esset integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aetas impedit, quominus agri colendi studia teneamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere, quae sit tanta formido, quae tot ac tantos viros impediat, quominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 25, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21832.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est igitur, quod me impediat ea quae probabilia mihi videantur sequi, quae contra, improbare? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me impedit pudor ab aliquo haec exquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua mora ignaros pubemque educere castris Impediat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 21</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (in analogy to impedimento esse): novitati non impedit vetus consuetudo, <hi rend="ital">is no hinderance</hi>, = obstat (cf. the context), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 20</bibl> Müll.: inpediat tibi, ne, etc., Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 49</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia removentur, quae obstant et impediunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia quae impediant, vincat intentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:55" default="NO">12, 10, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus ipsis utere tuo judicio—nihil enim impedio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl>: quem video, nisi rei publicae tempora impedient, <foreign lang="greek">*eu)po/riston</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 55</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hindered</hi>,<pb n="898" /> <cb n="IMPE" />  <hi rend="ital">embarrassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encumbered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impeded.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21832.10" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nunc quomodo me expeditum ex impedito faciam, jam consilium placet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>: inermos armati, impeditos expediti interficiunt, <hi rend="ital">encumbered with baggage</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 58, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impeditis hostibus propter ea quae ferebant onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere impediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri si ab illis initium transeundi (fluminis) fieret, ut impeditos aggrederentur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>embarrassed with the difficulties of crossing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 23, 1 et saep.: malis domesticis impediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden me consiliis tuis miserum impeditum esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: quod, si durior accidisset casus, impeditiores fore videbantur, Auct. B. Alex. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n21832.11" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem impedito atque iniquo loco tenetis,</quote> <trans><tr>difficult of passage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus impeditos gravis armis miles timere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae nexu traducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigationem impeditam (esse) propter inscientiam locorum,</quote> <trans><tr>troublesome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedito animo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>engaged</tr>, <tr>busy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium impeditis animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies tristi omine infames et impediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disceptatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio fit longa et impedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum (with arduum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum victoribus nihil impeditum arbitrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu rem impeditam et perditam restituas,</quote> <trans><tr>intricate and hopeless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius impeditioribus locis secuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saltus artior et impeditior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 21, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae undique impeditissimae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exceedingly difficult to pass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:77:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 77, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid horum non impeditissimum? vestitus an vehiculum an comes?</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly embarrassing</tr>, <tr>a great encumbrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impeditio: <entryFree id="n21833" type="main" key="impe^di_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdītĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impedio</etym>, <sense id="n21833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruction</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sine impeditione praeterire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus in somniis liber est sensibus et omni impeditione curarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impedito: <entryFree id="n21834" type="hapax" key="impe^di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:590" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 590</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impeditor: <entryFree id="n21835" type="main" key="impe^di_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hinderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstructer</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 10.</sense></entryFree>
impeditus: <entryFree id="n21836" type="main" key="impedi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impedītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from impedio.</entryFree>
impedo: <entryFree id="n21837" type="hapax" key="impe^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pedo</etym>, <sense id="n21837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impelimenta: <entryFree id="n21838" type="gloss" key="impe^li_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕlīmenta</orth>, v. impedimentum <sense id="n21838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impello: <entryFree id="n21839" type="main" key="impello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impello</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype> (archaic <sense id="n21839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> inpellier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1060" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1060</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pello</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">strike against</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21839.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21839.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cavum conversa cuspide montem Impulit in latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocales impellere pollice chordas,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:657" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 657</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infidum remis marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impellunt animae lintea Thraciae,</quote> <trans><tr>swell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras mugitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maternas aures Luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles canoris plausibus, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 175: cui patuere Alpes saxa impellentia caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:217" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 217</bibl></cit>: cum fretum non impulit Ister, <hi rend="ital">does not strike</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">does not empty into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 437</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsum ab eo dextri pedis pollice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitus antennas impulit ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21839.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., with the access. idea of motion, <hi rend="ital">to drive forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">biremes subjectis scutulis impulsas vectibus in interiorem partem transduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(navem) triplici versu (remorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppim remis velisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:568" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem (levis aura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum calce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:697" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 697</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornipedem planta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyris primum impellentibus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus (ventus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemissus eques postremos ac latera impulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: utque impulit arma, i. e. <hi rend="ital">brandished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourished</hi>, Verg. <cb n="IMPE" /> A. 8, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittam nervo,</quote> <trans><tr>to shoot</tr>, <tr>discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen vehementius urinam impellit,</quote> <trans><tr>drives down</tr>, <tr>promotes the discharge of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 118, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitantem igitur impellamus et perditum prosternamus,</quote> <trans><tr>give a push to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procumbunt orni, nodosa impellitur ilex,</quote> <trans><tr>is overthrown</tr>, <tr>thrown down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulit aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>forced to give way</tr>, <tr>broke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem primo impetu impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsis hostibus castra cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulit Vitellianos modica caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (hostem) si inpellere maturasset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">78 al.— Designating the limit: in fugam atque in latebras impellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque meos ferrum flammasque Penates Impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum capulo tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:382" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aufidus) in aequora fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:482" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 482</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:429" default="NO">14, 429</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque diem ad metas defessis Phoebus Olympo Impellebat equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:270" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 270</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21839.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21839.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To move to</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">to instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade</hi> (the predom. signif. in good prose); constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">aliquem in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ut;</hi> less freq. with a <hi rend="ital">terminal adverb</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, the simple <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21839.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem in aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi eum di immortales in eam mentem impulissent, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic in fraudem homines impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>;
