<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in fraudem impulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:89:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 89, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plurimas animum audientium species impellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21839.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem ad aliquid</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam quemque artem putabat esse aptum, ad eam impellere atque hortari solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad veterum annalium memoriam comprehendendam impulsi atque incensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile ad credendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ad omne facinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad maleficium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 21, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad injuriam faciendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 34, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad crudelitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad metum, cupiditatem, odium, conciliationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n21839.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa nos impulerit, ut haec tam sero litteris mandaremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanos tam facile impelli, ut in Galliam venirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 51</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n21839.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">terminal adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in dubio est animus, paulo momento huc illuc impellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulit huc animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntates impellere quo velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerunt quos pavor nando capessere fugam impulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mens tam dira Impulit his cingi telis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 520</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quendam impulit servilem ei amorem obicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:737" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:4" default="NO">5, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:5" default="NO">29, 4, 5</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut forte legentem Aut tacitum impellat quovis sermone,</quote> <trans><tr>to arouse</tr>, <tr>address</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:486" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 486</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praetor lictorem impellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis modo casus impulit hos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernacula multitudo, lasciviae sueta, impellere ceterorum rudes animos,</quote> <trans><tr>to instigate</tr>, <tr>stimulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit> Ritter. (Nipperd. implere).—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ut) qui audiunt aut impellantur aut reflectantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bellovacos impulsos ab suis principibus ab Aeduis defecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel iratum vel impulsum ab aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac fama impulsus Chremes ultro ad me venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsus irā ... Quibus iris impulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furore atque amentia impulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac impulsi occasione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Induciomari nuntiis impulsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassandrae impulsus furiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 68</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia et initio movendus sit judex et summo impellendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum simul terra, simul mari bellum impelleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:330" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 330</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: cui (<foreign lang="greek">daimoni/w|</foreign>) sempel ipse paruerit, numquam impellenti, saepe revocanti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nullo impellente fallebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno ictu frequenter impellunt (sententiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21839.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (rare): praecipitantem igitur impellamus, et perditum prosternamus, <cb n="IMPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseri post fata Sychaei ... Solus hic (Aeneas) inflexit sensus animumque labantem Impulit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has completely subdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impellere ruentem,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy completely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpulsas Vitellii res audietis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inmenso Achaicae victoriae momento ad impellendos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsum bellum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>brought near to a close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impellens quidquid sibi, summa petenti, obstaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum leviter est temptatum, ... et nunc maximo temporum nostrorum auctore prope inpulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impendeo: <entryFree id="n21840" type="main" key="impende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impendĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and (anteclass.) <sense id="n21840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-pendeo], <hi rend="ital">to hang over</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to overhang</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.; cf. immineo). </sense><sense id="n21840.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21840.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor in aedes illius impendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:26:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (gladius) impenderet illius beati cervicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae impendere apud inferos saxum Tantalo faciunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:980" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 980</bibl>: nucem impendere super tegulas, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 564</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impendentium montium altitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21840.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, mare quae impendent, vesco sale saxa peresa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 326</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21840.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hang</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hover over</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to impend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to threaten.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21840.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, constr. <hi rend="ital">in aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21840.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae in te impendent ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet undique omnes in me terrores impendeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21840.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc jam alia cura impendet pectori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus semper aliqui talis terror impendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas impendere iis, a quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi impenderet, coepit suspicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21840.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimborum nocte coortā Inpendent atrae formidinis ora superne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:254" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 254</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vero aderant jam et impendebant, quonam modo ea depellere potuissetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea, quae partim jam assunt, partim impendent moderate feramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum impendere Parthi videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: tanta malorum impendet <foreign lang="greek">*)ilia/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli magni timor impendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille quidem semper impendebit timor, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ea contentio quae impendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento impendente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum bellum impendet a Parthis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:60:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 60, § 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendentia ex ruinis et commutatione status publici pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21840.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res me impendet, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. me, p. 16 Müll.: tanta te impendent mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impensus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for impendens: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas atque tenebrae coperiunt maria ac terras inpensa superne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 491</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impensum ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1592" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1592</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impendia: <entryFree id="n21841" type="gloss" key="impendi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impendĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. impendium <sense id="n21841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impendio: <entryFree id="n21842" type="main" key="impendi^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impendĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impendium <sense id="n21842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impendiosus: <entryFree id="n21843" type="hapax" key="impendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impendĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impendium</etym>, <sense id="n21843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that spends too much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio inpendiosum praestat te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impendium: <entryFree id="n21844" type="main" key="impendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impendĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <sense id="n21844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> DE SVA IMPENDIA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 871, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1070, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 8</bibl>) [impendo], <hi rend="ital">money laid out</hi> on any thing, <hi rend="ital">outlay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expense</hi> (class.; most freq. in <number>plur.</number>; cf.: sumtus, impensa). </sense><sense id="n21844.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quaestum sibi instituisset sine impendio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:175" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 37, 68, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:134" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 14, 36, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 20</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">reposcere rationem impendiorum, quae in educationem contulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21844.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla fodiendi impendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21844.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21844.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Money paid out for a loan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usura quod in sorte accedebat impendium appellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">faenus et impendium recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes impendiis debilitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21844.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut impendiis etiam augere possimus largitatem tui muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna impendia mundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tribute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:88" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21844.6" n="B" level="2"> In <case>abl.</case> impendio. </sense><sense id="n21844.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">At</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with an expense</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with a loss</hi> of <pb n="899" /> <cb n="IMPE" /> any thing (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multatio non nisi ovium boumque inpendio dicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium risus pretium est, si probitatis impendio constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpendio miserorum experiri commentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpendio magis publico quam jactura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regi suo parvo impendio immortalitatem famae daturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantulo impendio ingens victoria stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21844.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impendĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>) (at great expense, i. e. as an intensive particle), <hi rend="ital">by a great deal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much;</hi> cf. impense under impendo (in vulg. lang.). </sense><sense id="n21844.9" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpendio magis animus gaudebat mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at ille inpendio nunc magis odit senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vero minus minusque inpendio Curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne hoc impendio venustius gratiusque est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendio probabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges impendio acerbiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendio gnarus sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21844.10" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: impendio infit, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum impendio excusarem, negavit veniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impendo: <entryFree id="n21845" type="main" key="impendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impendo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inpendo</etym>, <sense id="n21845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expend</hi> (class.; cf.: insumo, erogo). </sense><sense id="n21845.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe inquam, nam hoc inpendit puplicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erunt tam amentes, ut operam, curam, pecuniam impendant in eas res, quas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos in navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in opsonio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:31" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. octogies pro introitu novi sacerdotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc, quod tu de tua pecunia dicis impensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid impendit et in commune contulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certus sumptus impenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegebant, sese sibi et populo Romano, non Verri et Apronio serere, impendere, laborare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">121: sed quid ego vos, de vestro inpendatis, hortor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis aegram et claudentem oculos gallinam impendat amico tam sterili,</quote> <trans><tr>lay out the value of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21845.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to expend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensurus omne aevi sui spatium in id opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam usui alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium libris componendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota volumina in hanc disputationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim suam in plura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam, curam in aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sanguinis in socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid censetis in hoc foedere faciendo voluisse Mamertinos impendere laboris, operae, pecuniae, ne? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis impendunt curas distendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc oculum pro vobis impendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (studia) juvenibus erudiendis impenderam, Quint. prooem. § 1: omnia studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum laboris studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem exemplo,</quote> <trans><tr>to use as a warning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:33" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba animi proferre et vitam impendere vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 91</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21845.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">impensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (lit., profusely expended; hence), <hi rend="ital">ample</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21845.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">impenso pretio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>high</tr>, <tr>dear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl>; for which also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impenso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 245</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21845.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement: dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his rebus unus est solus inventus, qui ab hac tam impensa voluntate bonorum palam dissideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:62:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 62, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 964</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 4</bibl></cit> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensior cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 405</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias atrociores impensiore damno vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:32" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae misero illi, cujus cibo iste factuist impensior,</quote> <trans><tr>larger</tr>, <tr>stouter</tr>, <tr>fatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam pol ingrato homine nihil impensiu'st,</quote> <trans><tr>more expensive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-pensē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>). </sense><sense id="n21845.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">At great cost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensius unge, puer, caules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:68" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecas incendio absumptas impensissime reparari curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21845.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much; earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi> (freq.; <cb n="IMPE" /> esp. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.;</hi> cf.: magnopere, admodum, perquam, etc.). </sense><sense id="n21845.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi invidere misere, verum unus tamen impense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid impense cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque acriter atque inflammanter facit (odium in Verrem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl></cit> (this the better read. al. incense).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo facio id impensius, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerari numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescere his dignitas, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendi certamina in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 46, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21845.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impense improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impense doctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21845.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">impensa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pecunia), <hi rend="ital">outlay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expense</hi> (cf.: sumtus, impendium). </sense><sense id="n21845.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">impensam ac sumptum facere in culturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam impensam fecimus in macrocola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam impensam fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arationes magna impensa tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae nulla impensa dejectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">145: sine impensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris ac vitrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia inpensa pecuniae facienda erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nimia est inpensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem impensae non servat prodiga Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcere impensae,</quote> <trans><tr>to economize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 156</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque etiam impensae meliores, muri, navalia, portus, aquarum ductus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum ac munerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum ac munerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo meis impensis illorum ali luxuriam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of my reputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpensas conferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to contribute to expenses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:216" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21845.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (so perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n21845.13" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21845.14" n="b" level="4"> In partic., that which is used up or expended for any purpose, <hi rend="ital">materials</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingredients;</hi> for repairing an aqueduct (timber, stone, earth, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 124" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 124</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the stuffing for sausages, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 231</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of sacrifices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of masonry,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impenetrabilis: <entryFree id="n21846" type="main" key="impe^ne^tra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕnĕtrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpenetrabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be penetrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impenetrable</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n21846.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superior pars corporis crocodili (with dura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tergus hippopotami ad scuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 39, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeries imbribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruppellarii accipiendis ictibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae impenetrabilia quaeque pervia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21846.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patet impenetrabilis ille Luctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:413" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impenetrabilis blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:561" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitia Agrippinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impenetrale: <entryFree id="n21847" type="gloss" key="impe^ne^tra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕnĕtrāle</orth>, <itype>cujus ultimum penetrale intrare non licet</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
impennatae: <entryFree id="n21848" type="gloss" key="impenna_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impennātae</orth> <itype>agnae, in Saliari carmine spicas significat sine aristis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=211:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 211, 1</bibl> Müll.; v. pennatae.</entryFree>
impensa: <entryFree id="n21849" type="main" key="impensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impensa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, v. impendo <sense id="n21849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
impensatio: <entryFree id="n21850" type="main" key="impensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-penso</etym>, <sense id="n21850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the expenditure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlay.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impense: <entryFree id="n21851" type="main" key="impense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impensē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impendo, <sense id="n21851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impensus: <entryFree id="n21852" type="main" key="impensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. impendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21853" type="main" key="impensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impendo</etym>, <sense id="n21853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">outlay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expense</hi> (post-class. for impensa): <cit><quote lang="la">majore impensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperabiliter: <entryFree id="n21854" type="main" key="impe^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>impero</etym>, <sense id="n21854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an imperative</hi> manner, Cat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 202, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imperative: <entryFree id="n21855" type="main" key="impe^ra_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātīvē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n21855.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
imperativus: <entryFree id="n21856" type="main" key="impe^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impero</etym>, <sense id="n21856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceeding from a command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commanded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriae,</quote> <trans><tr>extraordinary</tr>, <tr>commanded by a magistrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, § 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <trans><tr>the imperative</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 313</bibl></cit>, and in the grammarians saep.— <cb n="IMPE" /> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">imperatively</hi>, Ulp. Reg. tit. 24, 1.</sense></entryFree>
imperator: <entryFree id="n21857" type="main" key="impe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype> (archaic form induperator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 86" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">332</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">350</bibl>; 552 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 967</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1227" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1227</bibl>; cf. 1. <sense id="n21857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; but in Enn. also imperator, Trag. v. 34 Vahl.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n21857.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a commander-in-chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">strathgo/s</foreign> (cf.: dux, ductor). </sense><sense id="n21857.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: si forte quaereretur, quae esset ars imperatoris, constituendum putarem principio, quis esset imperator: qui cum esset constitutus administrator quidam belli gerendi, tum adjungeremus de exercitu, de castris, etc.... de reliquis rebus, quae essent propriae belli administrandi: quarum qui essent animo et scientia compotes, eos esse imperatores dicerem, utererque exemplis Africanorum et Maximorum; <cit><quote lang="la">Epaminondam atque Hannibalem atque ejus generis homines nominarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae sunt legati partes, aliae imperatoris: alter omnia agere ad praescriptum, alter libere ad summam rerum consulere debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens et callidus imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus ac fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egregie fortis et bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eosdem labores non aeque esse graves imperatori et militi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic existimo in summo imperatore quatuor has res inesse oportere, scientiam rei militaris, virtutem, auctoritatem, felicitatem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum ad id bellum imperatorem deposci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen invicti imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistocles ... imperator bello Persico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro se quisque in conspectu imperatoris ... operam navare cuperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: insece, Musa, manu Romanorum induperator Quod quisque in bello gessit cum rege Philippo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 332 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">induperatores pugnare ac proelia obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 967</bibl></cit>.—As a title, placed after the name: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Cicero S. D. C. Antonio M. F. Imp.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5</bibl></cit> inscr.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Pompeio Cn. F. Magno Imperatori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl></cit> inscr.: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatinio Imp. S.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n21857.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., in the times of the republic, a title of honor conferred on a general after any important victory: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus gestis Curio se in castra ad Bagradam recepit, atque universi exercitus conclamatione Imperator appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius eo proelio Imperator est appellatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 71, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 542</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3417</bibl> sq. (cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:12:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 12, 1</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n21857.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere. </sense><sense id="n21857.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romani) immutato more annua imperia, binos imperatores sibi fecere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>consuls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vis venti) Induperatorem classis super aequora verrit,</quote> <trans><tr>admiral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator histricus,</quote> <trans><tr>director</tr>, <tr>manager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di te servassint semper ... salus interioris hominis amorisque inperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: nolo eundem populum imperatorem et portitorem esse terrarum, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 22</bibl> (Rep. 4, 7 Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">dux et imperator vitae mortalium animus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae nostrae necisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21857.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21857.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum Jovis Imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 29, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21857.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The conqueror</hi> at a game of chess, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Proc. 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21857.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The title of the Roman emperors</hi>, placed either before or after the name (cf. I.); <cit><quote lang="la">before it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">IMP. CAESARI DIVI IVLI F.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 596</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 597</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">600</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">602</bibl>; 604 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">after it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 22, 4</bibl>.—Hence afterwards <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Imperator,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman emperor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut praesagium insequentis casus, quo medius inter utriusque filios exstitit Imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 3, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
imperatorie: <entryFree id="n21858" type="main" key="impe^ra_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātōrĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imperatorius, I. <sense id="n21858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imperatorius: <entryFree id="n21859" type="main" key="impe^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imperator</etym>. <sense id="n21859.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a general</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipse honos laborem leviorem faceret imperatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">partes (shortly before: imperatoris partes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <pb n="900" /> <cb n="IMPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:11" default="NO">8, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis sudorque (opp. campestris meditatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:13:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <trans><tr>an admiral's ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a general</hi>: dum se ad id bellum imperatorie instruit, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21859.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to imperator, II. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">Imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genesis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperatrix: <entryFree id="n21860" type="main" key="impe^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imperator</etym>, <sense id="n21860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who commands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi> (very rare): deinde fortes viros ab imperatrice (i. e. Clodia) in insidiis locatos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 16</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">creatrice, Jan.): ut esset animae tam quam imperatrici suae caro subditiva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Inst. Virg. 2, § 11</bibl></cit>: imperatrix et Augusta Pulcheria, Leo. M. Ep. 101, 3; 98, 3.</sense></entryFree>
imperatum: <entryFree id="n21861" type="main" key="impe^ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. impero <sense id="n21861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imperatus: <entryFree id="n21862" type="main" key="impe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impero</etym>, <sense id="n21862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Fuga Saec. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ACILII GLABRIONIS IMPERATV,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatu Gratiani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperceptus: <entryFree id="n21863" type="main" key="imperceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperceptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in - perceptus</etym>, <sense id="n21863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unperceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minora majoribus imperceptiora sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>more incomprehensible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperco: <entryFree id="n21864" type="main" key="imperco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">imparco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n21864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spare</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">huic impercito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperce, quaeso,</quote> <trans><tr>spare yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impercussus: <entryFree id="n21865" type="hapax" key="impercussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impercussus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-percussus</etym>, <sense id="n21865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not struck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstruck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impercussos nocte movere pedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without noise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperditus: <entryFree id="n21866" type="main" key="imperdi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperdĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inperditus</etym>, <sense id="n21866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not destroyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not slain</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">et vos, o Graiis imperdita corpora, Teucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora Tydeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Sidoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:161" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperfecte: <entryFree id="n21867" type="main" key="imperfecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imperfectus <sense id="n21867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imperfectio: <entryFree id="n21868" type="main" key="imperfecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imperfectus</etym>, <sense id="n21868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperfection</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. de Genes. ad lit. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
imperfectus: <entryFree id="n21869" type="main" key="imperfectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inperfectus</etym>, <sense id="n21869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfinished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfect</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam homines in capite meo solum elaborarunt, reliquum corpus imperfectum ac rude reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam (animalia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 427</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars manebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>undigested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecto adhuc bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui imperfectum librum supple verit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Hirt. B. G. prooem. § 2: librum reliquerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae rudia atque imperfecta adhuc erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae (opp. perfectae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO">11, 3, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:958" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 958</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuavius hoc imperfectiusque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: sunt omnia in quaedam genera partita aut incohata nulla ex parte perfecta; <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecto autem nec absoluto simile pulchrum esse nihil potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21869.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">morally imperfect; plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (opp. sapientes): <cit><quote lang="la">ad imperfectos et mediocres et male sanos hic meus sermo pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">imperfectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompletely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecte atque praepostere syllogismo uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperfossus: <entryFree id="n21870" type="hapax" key="imperfossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfossus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perfossus</etym>, <sense id="n21870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpierced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstabbed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 496</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imperfundies: <entryFree id="n21871" type="hapax" key="imperfundi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperfundĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inperfundo</etym>, <sense id="n21871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurity</hi>: cruciatur illuvie, imperfundie, incuriā, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imperiabiliter: <entryFree id="n21872" type="hapax" key="impe^ri^a_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭābĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>imperium</etym>, <sense id="n21872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">commandingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperiously</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 181</bibl> P. (cf. imperabiliter).</sense></entryFree>
imperialis: <entryFree id="n21873" type="main" key="impe^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imperium, II. B. 3. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n21873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the empire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:12:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptum, Cod. Th. 3, 12, 2: ornamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia et omnia imperialia sic horruit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">imperially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 51, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> <cb n="IMPE" /></sense></entryFree>
imperiose: <entryFree id="n21874" type="main" key="impe^ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imperiosus <sense id="n21874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imperiosus: <entryFree id="n21875" type="main" key="impe^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭōsus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imperium</etym>, <sense id="n21875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">possessed of command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far-ruling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puissant</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21875.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: urbes magnae atque imperiosae, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: imperiosissima civitas, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 19 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 284</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">dictatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the fasces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisnam igitur liber? sapiens, sibi qui imperiosus,</quote> <trans><tr>who has dominion over himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiosissimae humanae mentis artes (religio, astrologia, medicina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus habet vim nescio an imperiosissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21875.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21875.3" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">imperious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domineering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyrannical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas honoris quam dura est domina, quam imperiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis imperiosus philosophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paedagogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiosus atque impotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiosi nobis ipsis et molesti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q.
