N. 4 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proserpina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojus cibo iste factust imperiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiosius aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia imperiosissima et superbissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21875.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Impĕrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the dictator L. Manlius Torquatus and his son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the consul T. Manlius Torquatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of their severity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 5, 5, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29, 6</bibl>; cf. Manlius.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">imperiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyrannically</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">non severe, non imperiose praecepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 202, 11</bibl>: paene imperiosius quam humanius, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 287, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imperite: <entryFree id="n21876" type="main" key="impe^ri_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrītē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imperitus <sense id="n21876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imperitia: <entryFree id="n21877" type="main" key="impe^ri_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrītĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imperitus</etym>, <sense id="n21877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inexperience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardness</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): Jugurtha, cognita vanitate atque imperitia legati, subdolus ejus augere amentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum Marius imperitia hostium confirmatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 99:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 99, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam imperitia poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperitia et rusticitas afferunt interim frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Circium serere, imperitia existimatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum atque verborum imperitia, Gell. N. A. praef. § 12: nimia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:109" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 109</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatico insolentiarum et imperitiarum pleno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
imperito: <entryFree id="n21878" type="main" key="impe^ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n21878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [impero], <hi rend="ital">to command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic. or Cæs.); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21878.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod antehac pro jure imperitabam meo, nunc te oro per precem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequam Rem imperito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 189</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21878.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">magnis gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1028" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1028</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis legionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, mihi qui imperitas, aliis servis miser,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo generi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nemori imperitet, quem tota armenta sequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam ipsam ceteris imperitantem industria vicerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteri populo cum bona pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod superbe avareque crederent imperitatum victis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21878.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veleda late imperitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia adductius quam civili bello imperitabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem imperitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido imperitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua tempestate Carthaginienses pleraque Africa imperitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 79:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.—Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi quoque exsequendum reor, quanto sit angustius imperitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
imperitus: <entryFree id="n21879" type="main" key="impe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inperitus</etym>, <sense id="n21879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inexperienced in</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">not knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without experience</hi> (class.; syn.: ignarus, rudis; opp. prudens, callidus); constr. usually with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21879.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines adulescentulos, inperitos rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi juris peritissimus, civilis non imperitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperitus foederis, rudis exemplorum, ignarus belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 175</bibl>: <cb n="IMPE" /> homo imperitus morum, agricola et rusticus, <hi rend="ital">with no experience of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines barbari et nostrae consuetudinis imperiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviciorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmatum quoque non imperitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21879.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homine inperito numquam quicquam injustius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in theatro imperiti homines, rerum omnium rudes ignarique consederant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum imperitus fraudasse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin apud indoctos imperitosque dicemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 26, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum imperiti facile ad credendum impellerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti prudentes cum imperitis manus consererent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis imperitior existimet, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imperitiores quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contio quae ex imperitissimis constat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo imperita et rudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma imperito quodam initio fusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21879.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his non imperitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: in verbis adeo imperitus, Quint 1, 4, 27; 12, 3, 5.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperite absurdeque fictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebat Scipio non imperite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:175" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excerpta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 24</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: hoc imperite (<hi rend="ital">suppl.</hi> factum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potuit dici imperitius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est illud imperitissime dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperium: <entryFree id="n21880" type="main" key="impe^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>impero</etym>, <sense id="n21880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direction.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21880.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.): si quid opus est, impera: imperium exsequar. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc pergam eri imperium exsequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eri imperia persequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequens obediensque est mori atque imperiis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo facit jussu, tuo imperio paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus et nequam est homo, qui nihili imperium eri Sui servus facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hi neque ad concilia veniebant neque imperio parebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium neglegere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ab uno omnia imperia administrari poterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio Jovis huc venio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 726</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et Jovis imperium et cari praecepta parentis Edocet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiis deūm propalam expositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam (pueri) imperia indignantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegri quoquo neglecto medentium imperio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:22:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti inest imperiorum obedientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae imperio gemimus, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus paruit imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:331" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 331</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21880.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">power of commanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n21880.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Mes.</hi> Nempe jubes? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Jubeo hercle, si quid imperii est in te mihi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 41</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius et caecus et senex tenebat non modo auctoritatem sed etiam imperium in suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges in ipsos imperium est Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eone es ferox, quia habes imperium in beluas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater, cujus sub imperio'st, mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">An.</hi> Sta ilico. <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Hem, sates pro imperio! quisquis es, i. e. <hi rend="ital">authorilatively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperiously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:47:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 47, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Juppiter) Divosque mortalesque turbas Imperio regit unus aequo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed me jussa deūm ... Imperiis egere suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phyllius illic Imperio pueri volucresque ferumque leonem Tradiderat domitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae habent rationem cum terra, quae numquam recusat imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21880.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21880.5" n="1" level="3"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">supreme power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empire</hi> (cf.: principatus, dominatus, regnum; potestas, potentia). </sense><sense id="n21880.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: Tarquinio dedit imperium simul et sola regni, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=298" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 298</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 151 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navorum imperium servare est induperantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib. 169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 169</bibl></cit> Müll. (Ann. v. 413 Vahl.); and: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (Numa rex) de suo imperio curiatam legem tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>; <pb n="901" /> <cb n="IMPE" /> 20; <cit><quote lang="la">21: homo dominandi cupidus aut imperii singularis,</quote> <trans><tr>sole dominion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulare et potestas regia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse consul cum summo imperio et potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summo imperio et potestate versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (App. Claudius) tum erat summo imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne imperium nostri penes singulos esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de imperio Caesaris ... gravissime decernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium extra ordinem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod imperium potest esse praestantius quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos qui antea commodis fuerint moribus, imperio, potestate, prosperis rebus immutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deponendum imperium tardior esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expertes imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponentium imperium tyrannorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 67</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub populi Romani imperium dicionemque cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with dicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia sub populi Romani imperium redacta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam ad imperium populi Romani Ciliciam adjunxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas est in imperio atque in omni populi Romani dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duobus ducibus de imperio in Italia decertatum est, Pyrrho et Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de imperio dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes diuturnitatis atque imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedem et domum summo imperio praebere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipse suae civitatis imperium obtenturus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitati imperium totius provinciae pollicetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 64</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum abunde expertus esset quam bene umeris tuis sederet imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:10" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritate magis quam imperio regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illum pro imperio submovere posse ... quia ita dicatur: si vobis videtur, discedite, Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 56, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21880.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero imperia expetenda ac potius aut non accipienda interdum aut deponenda nonnumquam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>public offices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cives) mandant imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honores, magistratus, imperia, potestates, opes amicitiae anteponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (duci) dantur imperia et ea continuantur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita cepi et gessi maxima imperia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides tyranni satellites in imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod praestare dicant Gallorum quam Romanorum imperia perferre,</quote> <trans><tr>dominion</tr>, <tr>government</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mobilitate ac levitate animi novis imperiis studebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia legum potentiora quam hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n21880.8" n="b" level="4"> Hence, transf., concr. </sense><sense id="n21880.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">realm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empire</hi> (esp. freq. since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">duae urbes inimicissimae huic imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ipsa terra ita mihi parva visa est, ut me imperii nostri pæniteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">finium imperii nostri propagatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines imperii propagavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium Oceano, famam qui terminet astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quas (artes) imperi Porrecta majestas ad ortus Solis ab Hesperio cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjectis Britannis Imperio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vocet divum populus ruentis Imperi rebus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 37, 8: immensum imperii corpus stare ac librari sine rectore non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges socii, membra partesque imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviarium totius imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationarium imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii fines Tiberinum natare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:265" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noverat luxuriam imperii veterem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Roman court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21880.10" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi> (very rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illud vide, si in animis hominum regale imperium sit, unius fore dominatum, consilii scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—Iron.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium judiciorum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactae imperio sexus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ambition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 135</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21880.11" n="2" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">the jurisdiction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discretion of a magistrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia autem judicia aut legitimo jure consistunt aut imperio continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:103" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo autem imperio contineri judicia dicuntur, quia tamdiu valent, quamdiu is qui ea praecepit imperium habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. 3, 181 al.— </sense><sense id="n21880.12" n="3" level="3"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">the chief command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21880.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum atque expugnatum oppidum est Imperio atque auspicio Amphitruonis maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 41</bibl>: re impetrata contendunt, ut ipsis summa <cb n="IMPE" /> imperii transdatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delatam sibi summam imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censet enim etiam ex iis, qui cum imperio sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri imperii dignitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem annis, quibus in imperio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum curam et imperium alicui demandare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui imperium prorogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii tempus explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: cum imperio aut magistratu, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a military</hi> or <hi rend="ital">civil command</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dabat olim imperium, fasces, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n21880.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandant (cives) imperia, magistratus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>military and civil commands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus, imperia, amicitiae anteponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 61</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21880.15" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21880.16" n="(a)" level="5"> Concr.: imperia, i. q. imperatores, <hi rend="ital">commanding officers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commanders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia, potestates, legationes, quom senatus creverit populusve jusserit, ex urbe exeunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nacti vacuas ab imperiis Sardiniam et Siciliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21880.17" n="(b)" level="5"> Erat plena lictorum et imperiorum provincia, differta praefectis atque exactoribus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21880.18" n="(g)" level="5"> (Acc. to imperator, II. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">The imperial government</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the government</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem quasi coactus recepit imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
imperjuratus: <entryFree id="n21881" type="hapax" key="imperju_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperjūrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-; -pējūr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perjuratus</etym>, <sense id="n21881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is never sworn falsely by</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the Styx: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impermeabilis: <entryFree id="n21882" type="main" key="imperme^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impermĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-permeabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be passed through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not traversable</hi>: oceani fines, Jorn. Get. 1.</sense></entryFree>
impermisceo: <entryFree id="n21883" type="main" key="impermisce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impermiscĕo</orth>, <itype>mixtus, ēre</itype>, <sense id="n21883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.</hi> 2 [inpermisceo], <hi rend="ital">to mix in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle</hi> as an ingredient: impermixtum esse alicui rei, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 5, 5 al.</sense></entryFree>
impermissus: <entryFree id="n21884" type="hapax" key="impermissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impermissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-permissus</etym>, <sense id="n21884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlawful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbidden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impermixtus: <entryFree id="n21885" type="main" key="impermixtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impermixtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-permixtus</etym>, <sense id="n21885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmixed</hi>: lymphor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 3</bibl>; Ambros. de Noe, 3, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 65, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
impero: <entryFree id="n21886" type="main" key="impe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic form, imperassit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl>, and induperantum = imperantium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 413" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 413</bibl> Vahl.), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-paro</etym>, <sense id="n21886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoin</hi> (cf.: jubeo, praecipio, mando). </sense><sense id="n21886.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. with <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, with the simple <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21886.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (and <hi rend="ital">dat. personæ</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">faciendum id nobis quod parentes imperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac quod imperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae imperarentur, facere dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid aliud imperas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sto exspectans, si quid mihi imperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam etiam puerum vocaret: credo, cui cenam imperaret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ordered to get him his supper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperat ei nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram et sollicitudinem initiis impero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: graves dominae cogitationum libidines infinita quaedam cogunt atque imperant, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 424, 30</bibl> (Rep. 6, 1 Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">utque Imperet hoc natura potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma imperata a populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsum imperari optimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperata pensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplar imperatae schemae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21886.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (esp. freq. in the post-Aug. per.; in Cic. and Cæs. only with <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">animo nunc jam otioso esse impero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperavi egomet mihi omnia assentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungere equos Titan velocibus imperat Horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus in certo dentes cadere imperat aetas Tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has omnes actuarias imperat fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula vilia habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum conportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liviam ad se deduci imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: in has lautumias, si qui publice custodiendi sunt, ex ceteris oppidis deduci imperantur, Cic. Verr. <cb n="IMPE" /> 2, 5, 27, § 69.—*With <hi rend="ital">inf. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego procurare et idoneus imperor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21886.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">imperabat coram, quid opus facto esset puerperae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu, quod faciam, impera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 3</bibl> and 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21886.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce Apollo mihi ex oraculo imperat, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his, uti conquirerent et reducerent, imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulibus designatis imperavit senatus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: quibus negotium a senatu est imperatum, ut, etc., S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 104" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi, ne abscedam, imperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar suis imperavit, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 89, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">letoque det imperat Argum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 670</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 659</bibl>. — (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With simple <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si huic imperabo, probe tectum habebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. above <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl>. — (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Absol.: Pa.</hi> Jubesne? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Jubeo, cogo atque impero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid opus est, impera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impera, si quid vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia faciam: impera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis oneris impone, impera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21886.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21886.7" n="A" level="2"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">to order to be furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supplied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give orders for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a requisition for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum frumentum sibi in cellam imperavisset (Verrem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (numerum frumenti) ei civitati imperas emendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:74:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 74, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negas fratrem meum pecuniam ullam in remiges imperasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 32; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti pondo ducenta milia Jugurthae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites civitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maximum militum numerum provinciae toti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides reliquis civitatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 64, 1</bibl></cit>; so, obsides <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n21886.8" n="B" level="2"> In publicists' and milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (magistratibus) praescribendus est imperandi modus ... qui modeste paret, videtur, qui aliquando imperet, dignus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic noster populus in pace et domi imperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est tam stulta civitas, quae non injuste imperare malit, quam servire juste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: cum is, qui imperat aliis, servit ipse nulli cupiditati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus gentibus ac nationibus terra marique imperare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus esse belli, ut, qui vicissent, iis, quos vicissent, quemadmodum vellent imperarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha omni Numidiae imperare parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot nationibus imperabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus Anchisae Venerisque sanguis Imperet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Carm. Sec. 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recusabat imperare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be emperor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:5:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum quandoque imperaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 2</bibl> et saep.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n21886.9" n="b" level="4"> Ad imperandum, <hi rend="ital">to receive orders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instructions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ades ad imperandum, vel ad parendum potius: sic enim antiqui loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse ad imperandum Tisidium vocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 8</bibl></cit> Kritz.—</sense><sense id="n21886.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the publicist's sphere, <hi rend="ital">to command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare sibi, maximum imperium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nobismet ipsis imperemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homines cupiditatibus iis, quibus ceteri serviunt, imperabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensae irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:652" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare animo nequivi, quin, priusquam perirem, cur periturus essem, scirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: quibus egestas imperat, <hi rend="ital">rules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governs</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. v. 357 Vahl.): imperat arvis, <hi rend="ital">holds control over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forces to be productive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 99</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sola terrae seges imperatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertilibus agris non est imperandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic imperant vitibus et eas multis palmitibus onerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius patrimonio suo plus imperavit quam ferre possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also trop.: tamquam nescias, cui imperem: Epicurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum per continuos dies nimis imperat voci, rursus sanguinem reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: imperat ergo viro <pb n="902" /> <cb n="IMPE" /> (mulier), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:224" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 224</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum rege, qui, nisi paret, Imperat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permittat, an vetet an imperet (lex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eloquentia) hic regnat, hic imperat, hic sola vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21886.11" n="C" level="2"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">to order</hi> the citizens <hi rend="ital">to assemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to summon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dein consul eloquitur ad exercitum: Impero qua convenit ad comitia centuriata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 88</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so comically,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 60</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21886.12" n="D" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescribe</hi>: non idem imperassem omnibus per diversa aegrotantibus, Sen. de Ira, 1, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vires patiuntur, imperanda tridui abstinentia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21886.13" n="E" level="2"> In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperandi declinatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inflections of the imperative</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 32</bibl></cit> Müll.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕ-rātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is commanded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussus arma abicere, imperatum facit,</quote> <trans><tr>executes the order</tr>, <tr>obeys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperata facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 10, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 60, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 2 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperata detrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senones ad imperatum non venire,</quote> <trans><tr>according to orders</tr>, <tr>as ordered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperpetuus: <entryFree id="n21887" type="hapax" key="imperpe^tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperpĕtŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perpetuus</etym>, <sense id="n21887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not perpetual</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imperscrutabilis: <entryFree id="n21888" type="main" key="imperscru_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperscrūtābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-per-scrutabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impenetrable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscrutable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; Hilar. Trin. 11, 47.</sense></entryFree>
impersonalis: <entryFree id="n21889" type="main" key="imperso_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impersōnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpersonalis</etym>, <sense id="n21889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impersonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, in grammar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2</bibl></cit> and 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1</bibl> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impersōnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impersonally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive impersonaliter dari servus meus stipuletur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without naming the person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:3:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—Gramm. t. t., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> de Diff. 20, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impersonativus: <entryFree id="n21890" type="hapax" key="imperso_na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impersōnātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. modus) [2. in - persona], <sense id="n21890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the impersonal mood</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the infinitive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 331</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
imperspicabilis: <entryFree id="n21891" type="main" key="imperspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperspĭcābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inperspicabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be seen through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscrutable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de An. 3</bibl></cit>; Ambros. de Fide, 3, 14, § 110.</sense></entryFree>
imperspicuus: <entryFree id="n21892" type="hapax" key="imperspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperspĭcŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perspicuus</etym>, <sense id="n21892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imperterritus: <entryFree id="n21893" type="main" key="imperterri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperterrĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perterritus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n21893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undaunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unterrified</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 770</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 37, § 50</bibl>; Greg. M. in Job, 6, 38.</sense></entryFree>
impertilis: <entryFree id="n21894" type="main" key="imperti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impertĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-partilis</etym>, <sense id="n21894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mus. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mus. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
impertinens: <entryFree id="n21895" type="main" key="imperti^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impertĭnens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpertinens</etym>, <sense id="n21895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not belonging thereto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di (i. e. Seditio, Discordia, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impertio: <entryFree id="n21896" type="main" key="impertio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impertio</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">impartio</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 36</bibl>), īvi or ĭi, ītum (old <sense id="n21896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> impertibis, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 27, 33</bibl>; Com. Fragm. v. 12 Rib.), 4 (also in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-pertior</orth>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> impertiri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 215 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-partio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to share with another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to communicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi> a thing (class.; a favorite word of Cic.; cf. communico, participo, partior).—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quam praestantiam virtutis, ingenii, fortunae consecuti sunt, impertiant ea suis communicentque cum proximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneris mei partem nemini impertio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te exorabo, ut mihi quoque et Catulo tuae suavitatis aliquid impertias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperti etiam populo potestatis aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 28</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid impertivit tibi sui consilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum diem festum Marcellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem suum nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: molestias senectutis suae vestris familiis, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 25</bibl> (Rep. 5, 8 Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">Terentia impertit tibi multam salutem,</quote> <trans><tr>salutes thee heartily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominibus indigentibus de re familiari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talem te et nobis impertias,</quote> <trans><tr>wouldst show</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te peto, ut aliquid impertias temporis huic quoque cogitationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl></cit>, A, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum temporis huic studio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures studiis honestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid suorum studiorum philosophiae quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: meum laborem hominum periculis<cb n="IMPE" />  sublevandis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis gaudium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugibus liberisque tam laetum nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 51, 7</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tuae prudentiae ad salutem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ignis) ceteris naturis omnibus salutarem impertit et vitalem calorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic plausus maximi, signa praeterea benevolentiae permulta a bonis impertiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro forti collegae meo laus impertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro his impertitis oppugnatum patriam nostram veniunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for these favors</tr>, <tr>benefits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 13</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quibus potest, impertit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid novisti rectius istis, candidus imperti: si non, his utere mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21896.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: aliquem aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to make one a sharer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">partaker in</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to present him with</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): advenientem peregre erum suum Stratippoclem Salva impertit salute Epidicus,</quote> <trans><tr>greets</tr>, <tr>wishes health</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenonem suum plurima salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecret, se ut nuntio hoc impertiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quemquam osculo impertiit, ac ne resalutatione quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solos numquam donis impertiendos putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquit eum nullo praeter auguralis sacerdotii honore impertitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinis, quibus puerilis aetas impertiri debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">cesso eram hoc malo impertiri propere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impertior: <entryFree id="n21897" type="main" key="impertior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impertior</orth> <itype>īri</itype>, v. preced. art. <sense id="n21897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> et <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impertitio: <entryFree id="n21898" type="main" key="imperti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impertītĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impertio</etym>, <sense id="n21898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imparting</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impertitus: <entryFree id="n21899" type="main" key="imperti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impertītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impertio.</entryFree>
imperturbabilis: <entryFree id="n21900" type="main" key="imperturba_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperturbābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perturbabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperturbable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus quietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:2:10" default="NO">2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
